results.description:
Meetup/Hangout – 9:45 am

Whole Foods (Union Square) -- upstairs cafe. Show up a bit early to say hi, chat, and drop off any thing you don’t want to run with: jackets, bags, phones, etc. Somebody will always stay to watch the stuff.

Run – 10:00 am

Run 1 mile, 3 miles, 5 miles, or whatever you want. We'll head to the West Side Highway together. No pressure and no limits. Totally informal. Lots of different paces for lots of different people. Even walking speed is encouraged!

Brunch – 10:45 am

Whole Foods has ALL THE FOOD. Come get some.

What to expect: a seriously fun group of runners who definitely do not take running too seriously . We will meet, chat, RUN, stretch, chat, EAT BREAKFAST and then leave. It’s that easy. First we run, then we eat!

This is a co-ed adult soccer lesson with Coach Moe. All skill levels are welcome. Bring a ball if you have one.


We will be practicing a variety of skills including dribbling, passing/receiving, feinting, shooting, ball control, positioning, tactical training, etc.

Skill exercises will be alternating with strength/agility exercises.

Small sided games

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club programs or activities.

results.description:
Join us on Saturday, November 14, 2015 at 10:00 a.m. to hear Jeremy Kareken, East Coast Regional Director of Our America Initiative, speak about the two Federal Lawsuits filed against the Federal Election Commission and the Commission on Presidential Debates to open up the process to allow more candidates to participate. How are they similar? How are they different? Which has a chance of being successful?

One of the two federal lawsuits was spearheaded by Our America Initiative and the second was started by Level The Playing Field. Both have multiple plaintiffs and multiple defendants and are based on slightly different grounds. The OAI lawsuit argues that the Federal Election Commission is allowing the Commission on Presidential Debates to create a monopoly in trade and that the debates should have more liberal criteria on anti-trust grounds.

Do these lawsuits have any chance of success or is the Commission on Presidential Debates a private, non-partisan organization that can establish whatever criteria it wants in deciding who shall be permitted to participate.

Jeremy Kareken is East Coast Regional Director of Our America Initiative and an Adjunct Professor of Writing and Speech at New York University.  

The event will take place in the Library of the Queens Pride House located at[masked]th Avenue, Suite 206, Jackson Heights, New York 11372. 

ADMISSION FEE: $5.00 

If you are driving, arrive early to look for free street parking. There are also many 2-hour Muni-Meter spots and a nearby parking lot.

If you are coming by subway, use the IRT "7" Flushing Line and exit at 74th Street/Broadway. You can also use the IND "E", "F" or "R" Queens Blvd. Lines and exit at the Jackson Heights/Roosevelt Avenue stop.

If you get lost, call Dr. Tom Stevens on his cell phone at[masked]
results.name: Jeremy Kareken on Lawsuits Against The Commission On Presidential Debates

results.description:
LEADER: Jeffrey Sovelove ([masked])

RATING: B 6 B

We will start at Turtleback Rock trailhead at 10AM. See the Essex County Parks Commission website http://www.essex-countynj.org/p/index.php?section=parks/sites/so for directions. Bring lots of water, and wear hiking boots. We will take the orange trail down to Hemlock Falls and also see the famous Turtleback Rock. Heavy/steady rain cancels. Joint ADK/Sierra Club hike.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

results.description:
</a>Each year we tour a little piece of Brooklyn and make it our own - at least for a few hours.  Hosted by Nancy Jonap and Renata Luisi.

<a href="https://tourofbrooklyn-2015.eventbrite.com">Signup on Eventbrite

https://www.eventbrite.com/custombutton?eid=18927637072

This year on Saturday Nov 14th we will visit the new hot area called "Industry City". Our "The Industrial Strength Walk" takes place "Along The Waterfront", where once lived the famous movie characters in Red Hook, although it was filmed in Hoboken. The walk through Red Hook takes you in and around old shipping docks and warehouses. 

There's 2 parts to the walk. The first section is about a 9-mile walk to Industry City from City Hall Park where the walks starts. We cross the Brooklyn Bridge and walk the waterfront south to Red Hook. We walk to the Industry City section and to the current location of popular Brooklyn Flea and Smorgasburg, a great place to stop, shop and eat. (Subway close by). You can also continue for another 3 miles to the second part of the walk which is a tour of Greenwood Cemetery.

A few highlights:

Walk over Brooklyn BridgeBrooklyn Bridge Park.  A stop at Steve's Authentic Key Lime Pies Pass Buttermilk Channel, a 1 mile long tidal strait separating Governors Island from Brooklyn.  Fairway Market and IKEA (there's ferry service back to NYC-Pier 11.  It's free on weekends). Interesting Red Hook Waterfront site. It has photos and history.

http://redhookwaterfront.com

. Brooklyn Flea and Smorgasburg Brooklyn Crab for seafood and Maryland-type crabsGreenwood Cemetery - like no other - meet the famous in their resting placeMore information will be posted as we map out the walk. Size of group may be limited so sign up asap.


IC - Facebook page

</a> <a href="https://tourofbrooklyn-2015.eventbrite.com/">Signup on Eventbrite


https://www.eventbrite.com/custombutton?eid=18927637072


Inside a IC Building


Greenwood Cemetery
results.name: Tour of Brooklyn 2015 - The Industrial Strength Walk

FREE Circuit Training Saturdays! A 50-minute non-stop intense workout. You will sweat off the weight, you will burn calories, you will gain muscle. All levels welcome. We vow to never give up on you. For we will do everything in our power to help you reach your goal. We operate in a judgement free zone to facilitate your comfort. We promise you will progress.

This Class consist of running, walking, floor exercise, abdominal  workouts, squats, jumprope, and much more. You always have the option to perform the modified version of any drill! This allows beginners or anyone with a minor injury to comfortable fit right in. Build your strength and endurance to perform the unmodified versions of the drill when you see FIT (pun intended :)!! All while moving to be beat of the music. Bring your family, bring your friends. 

Need further assistants locating us? Call[masked], someone will be happy to guide you! Note: We may not answer the phone during class hours!

results.description:
Beautiful Harriman State Park is my playground; it's one of the largest wild areas near NYC. I've been hiking and paddling there dozens of times yet there are still thousands of acres in the park I've not seen.

Come with me today as we go on a day hike and explore a bit.

Our path will wind over a series of low mountains as it leads us to quiet and pristine Lake Skenonto. This loop hike has it all -- a combination of heart-accelerating climbs, breath-taking views and a seemingly untouched lake. And if we are lucky and my map reading skills are sharp this day, we may be able to explore an abandoned mine or two.

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event; your organizer is in the running for hardest working person on meetup. While everyone else is running in the other direction, I'll be the first one to jump in front of that bear when he tries to eat you.

The Important Stuff ...

• This is going to be an INTERMEDIATE hike of about 8 miles. You don't need to be a world-class athlete to participate, but you need to be in decent physical shape. We will be out all day so leave your afternoon/evening open.

• This is a social hike, the pace will be moderate -- we'll be stopping to take in the views and smell the flowers. If you yearn to channel your inner Mountain Goat and feel the need to race everyone to the top of the mountain, this is not the hiking trip for you.

• Dress for cold weather activity in layers of non-cotton clothing, wear hiking boots or trail shoes (I wouldn't recommend sneakers but that is at your discretion), a hat, bring 2 liters of fluid, a packed lunch and/or snacks.

• Rain cancels the hike.

• No guests allowed, sorry.

How To Get There ...

Train: Take the 9:14 AM New Jersey Transit Northeast Corridor train from Penn Station to Secaucus Junction, where you will transfer to the Port Jervis line train and take that to Tuxedo, NY. You'll arrive at 10:17 AM and we'll meet at the train station to start the hike. Round trip train fare is $21.75.

Driving: Tuxedo is about an hour drive from NYC. Take the George Washington Bridge to the Palisades Interstate Highway heading North. In about 19 miles exit the parkway at exit 9W onto the Thruway (Route 87/287) which heads west. About 10 miles later, exit the Thruway at exit 15A. At the exit turn left onto Route 17 North. After about 4.9 miles you will see the Tuxedo (Park) Train and Police Stations on your right. You can park in the commuter lot (W[masked], N[masked]) for free on weekends and holidays.

Please post if you are driving and can pick up passengers (how many and from where), If you need a ride, please be proactive and contact a driver directly. Passengers, as a courtesy you should chip in for gas, tolls, and coffee for the driver.
results.name: Not So Urban Athletics: Hike Lake Skenonto

venue.name: Wallenberg Square

results.description:
I  moved this Hike to make way for the October BBQ.  

The All In The Family TV Show opened with the front of a house.   On the show they give the address of 402 Houser street which is a fictional address.  The location of the house is on Cooper and Woodhaven Blvd which is walking distance from Forest Park.   

We will walk a short distance on the Orange Trail to the 71 street Exit.  Then we go along city streets to get to the house.  

We can decide as a group if we want to continue to Atlas Park.  I enjoy the Chillis  Restaurant at Atlas Park. 

I'm considering using the Metropolitan Avenue Bus to get back to Wallenberg.  

We meet at Wallenberg square at 10:30. At 10:45 sharp we start!

The hike should last about  two and a half hours, + or - a bit.


The total length should be about five miles or so.
We are asking for a voluntary $1.00 fee to help pay our meetup site fees.

Hope to Cya there!
results.name: Forest Park  - All In The Family Landmark Hike with Atlas Park Chillis

results.description:
Well Jonathan is having a end of season party, but its still warm and we can still play.  Weather is predicted to be 62 degrees next Saturday.  This course like all city course are setup for both beginners and advance golfers.  

Fee will be $59 per golfer.   This will include Greens Fee, Cart and Lunch (consisting of either a Hot Dog or Hamburger and 2 sodas).   You can't beat this deal.  Refunds will be given up until Noon November 6, 2015.  

Car Pooling:  Please answer the questions to make this process easier.  Will be done on a best efforts, no guarantees.  This course can be reached by mass transit.  

Clearview Park Golf Course:


Located at the foot of the Throgs Neck Bridge in Queens, Clearview Park Golf Course is the busiest 18-hole course on the east coast for good reason. Recent renovations on this 6,328-yard par 70 course accent the original design to provide golfers of all levels with an exceptional experience. Newly constructed forward, mid, and back tees are forgiving for beginners but include challenges for golfers of all skill levels. The new 8,000-square-foot putting green is a great place to warm up or sharpen your short game, and the spectacularly-remodeled clubhouse provides a terrific locale for events of all sizes and types, available for both indoor and outdoor celebrations. Whether you’re looking for a relaxing day on the course, a setting for your next special event, or just an enjoyable escape from the city, Clearview Park Golf Course has the experience and amenities to meet your needs and exceed your expectations.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
The #1 asked question is, “But where do you get your protein from?” Every vegan and vegetarian knows this question all too well. And, every omnivore and carnivore wants to know. The Seed will address this big question at its event: The Seed : PLANT PROTEIN POWER.

For one day only, we will bring together the leaders in the plant-based protein world. Exhibitors will be sampling and selling their products and services, while renowned doctors, nutritionists, and inspirational professional athletes will share their wisdom.

Discover the world of plant-based proteins
Over 45 exhibitors will be sampling, selling and showcasing their products and services.
World renowned nutritionists, doctors, and professional athletes will be presenting and giving workshops.
Learn about the benefits of plant-based diet and find out what make plant protein special.

For more information please visit: http://theseedexperience.com/plantprotein/

There are
Limited amount of complimentary tickets are now available using code "ppp2015" All proceeds go to Catskills Animal Sanctuary SPEAKERS!

Dr. Garth Davis-Key Note!!
MD & Book Author
As a leader in the field of bariatric medicine, Dr. Garth Davis was again recently recognized as a Texas Monthly Super Doc and stars with his father, Dr. Robert Davis, on the hit show docu-reality medical series, BIG MEDICINE. Get a copy if his book Proteinaholic. If you haven't already friend him on FB. Erika Mitchener
Founder of ePower Living
Erika fell in love with health, fitness, and philosophy at the age of 12 when she started training in martial arts. Growing up and training hard in the dojo set the foundation later in life for her to pursue her dream job as personal trainer, nutrition and lifestyle coach.

Marc Stafford Wood
Whole Plant-Based Food Health Coach
Marc studied the T Colin Campbell course on Plant-Based diet through Cornell University and have health coaching certification with the Wellness institute. He is an advocate on health, animal compassion and the environment, He belived that being a Vegan has a tremendously positive impact on all three subjects.

My personal friend Omowale Adewale
Certified Boxing Coach and Fitness Trainer
Wale is an author, champion boxer, MMA fighter, track and field collegiate gold medalist, accomplished bodybuilder and certified boxing coach and fitness trainer in New York City.

Jenné Claiborne
Vegan Personal Chef, Cooking Instructor, and Health Coach
Jenné is the creator of the vegan food and lifestyle blog Sweet Potato Soul. She is also a NYC based vegan personal chef, cooking instructor, and health coach. Jenné’s favorite Sweet Potato Soul recipes include her daily Buddha bowl, Sweet Potato Hash, and Fig Walnut Bars.

Isabelle Steichen
Plant-Based Health Coach and Certified Yoga Teacher
Isabelle is passionate about veganism and health and has a plant-based nutrition certificate from e-Cornell. The Plantiful is her blog and creative outlet that she uses to share her love for all things plant-based.

Schedule 11:00 AM Morning Yoga Diana M. Paschal

12:00 PM Veganism, Globalism & the Fight Game Omowale Adewale

1:00 PM Optimal health and performance through plant-based whole foods Erika Mitchener

2:00 PM Peaceful protein Marc S Wood

3:00 PM ProteinAcholic Dr. Garth Davis

4:00 PM Cooking demo – Long Live Legumes Jenné Claiborne & Isabelle Steichen

results.description:
I will start with the simplest scenario whereby the Brout-Englert-Higgs scalar field endows particles with mass. I will then use a Newtonian analogy to highlight some of the amazing ramifications of this mechanism.

Jeff will present the superconductivity concepts at the foundation of the BEH mechanism, show how it breaks the symmetry  of electro-weak interactions, and how it can be generalized to do the same for Quantum Chromo Dynamics to become a corner stone of the Standard Model.


For an excellent (though not required) lecture that covers some of the topics we will discuss see e.g.,  "Demystifying the Higgs Boson with Leonard Susskind"

https://video.search.yahoo.com/video/play;_ylt=A2KLqIC9.EBWhGoAgGgsnIlQ;_ylu=X3oDMTByZWc0dGJtBHNlYwNzcgRzbGsDdmlkBHZ0aWQDBGdwb3MDMQ--?p=Leonard+Susskind+Higgs+Youtube&vid=da9d1384889ea7930145299badab...

We will meet at 11:00 AM in room 122 in the main building of NY public library. The room has only 15 chairs so early RSVP is suggested.

Cheers,

Moshe

results.description:
This exquisite museum has to be seen to be believed. Home to tons of the beautiful artwork of sculptor Isamu Noguchi, it also includes a serene Japanese rock garden. Attendance here is strictly capped, so sign up now!

The museum is located in Long Island City, Queens, in a cool triangular building across the street from a huge Costco. It's a close walk to the Broadway N/Q stop. We'll meet at the entrance.

Any problems on the day of the event, I can be reached at [masked]. 


Looking forward to sketching with you!


---------------------------------------------------------------

What makes our Meetups different from other art groups and classes? There's no instruction, but we like to share our work, and chat and be inspired. Share tips and learn from people in a casual environment where all levels of artists are welcome! Don't be shy to ask anyone anything!

• We sketch for a bit, usually 45 minutes or so, and then get back together and share our drawings, and then sketch again, etc. There's usually time for 3 or 4 sketches.

• Please bring your own supplies - anything you like to work with - pens, pencil, watercolor, pastel, small sketchbook or large paper, iPad, whatever suits you.

• We hand out nametags so everyone can meet one another!

• We take photos to share on the site later. Bring your camera!

• Please take care to make sure we do not leave any trash behind. Please also leave any dogs at home; they tend to knock over the artwork. Thanks. 

• This Meetup is FREE and everyone at all skill levels is welcome!

In case of rain, I will let people know early in the morning if it is canceled, and then reschedule for another day.

How does the Wait List work? If the event is full, rsvp to be added to the Wait List. If someone from the regular list cancels, the first person on the Wait List is automatically bumped up to regular attendee.

Please note that if you add a comment below it will spam everyone with an email, so please use your judgement.
results.name: Draw the Noguchi Museum!

results.description:
RSVP'S BEGIN THURSDAY AT 1:00PM. 

Note our meetup location is outside the Patel Brothers store, which they claim to be the "largest South Asian store in the world".  Arrive early as you may want to browse and/or purchase some snacks or spices.  (this could turn into a food tour!)

This walking tour of Jackson Heights, one of New York's most  international and distinctive neighborhoods, is in honor of the recently-released documentary film "Jackson Heights," directed by Frederick Wiseman.  The movie is showing at the Film Forum in Manhattan: http://filmforum.org/ just through Tuesday, November 17th.  Note it is a 190-minute film (3 hours).  

Jackson Heights is believed to be the first garden community built in the United States as part of the international garden city movement at the turn of the 20th century.  By 1925 Jackson Heights was the largest community in the world of cooperatively owned garden apartment homes under a single management.


 (from the description of the movie courtesy of The Film Forum: Today's Jackson Heights "is one New York’s most diverse neighborhoods, with immigrants from Peru, Colombia, Mexico, India, Bangladesh, and Pakistan, to name a few (167 languages are spoken) -- as well as elderly residents of Jewish, Irish and Italian extraction. Under the elevated train, a hodge-podge of stores sell whole baby goats, saris, and Bollywood DVDs; they offer HIV testing, Tibetan food, and classes for would-be cabbies. Jackson Heights is home to an activist LGBT community, to recent survivors of terrifying border crossings, students of the Quran, and small shop-owners who mobilize against the Williamsburg-ization of the nabe. Wiseman embraces a community that revels in still being affordable, 20 minutes from “the city,” and resolutely unhip."
results.how_to_find_us: E or F train to Roosevelt Avenue, Jackson Heights. Walk about one-half block down 74th Street
results.name: Let's Explore the Community Of Jackson Heights, Queens!

results.description:
This week we’ll explore Renunciation, the third of the ten perfections - our inherent good heart qualities. 

Many of us have been conditioned to see renunciation as a kind of penance or deprivation or punishment; maybe a way of 'paying for our sins.' But, here, although challenging and certainly requiring courage, the teachings speak of renunciation as freedom from or letting go of anything that binds us to stories of suffering we create for ourselves. 

The most common and insistent ways we make ourselves unhappy is through our grasping and greediness toward things outside ourselves; things we believe will make us feel happy, safe, and secure. We want things that stay the same and are unchanging. However, despite our best efforts, we can plainly see that everything is really impermanent and always changing.  When we can deeply accept that reality and apply it to our own attachments and desires, the letting go or renunciation of those things happens naturally. We move toward more freedom from suffering.

The Ten Perfections or qualities of mind are:

Generosity (Giving)
Virtue (Morality/Ethics)
Renunciation (Letting go of obstacles to awakening)
Wisdom (Discernment)
Energy (Effort)
Patience (Endurance)
Truthfulness
Determination/Resolution
Loving Kindness/Goodwill
Equanimity (Impartiality and balance)

The brief topic discussion will be followed by a guided meditation and time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. I hope you'll join us.


Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.
results.name: The Ten Perfections - Renunciation

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

venue.name: Peter Jay Sharp Theater at Symphony Space

results.description:
Get ready for an incredible experience with JUSTIN ROBERTS on Saturday, November 14th at Symphony Space. Symphony Space has generously provided NYC Dads Group with 10 pairs of FREE passes (20 tickets total) to the 11 am show, plus a meet and greet back stage with Justin after the show. Additionally, all dads with more than one child or who want to bring their significant other will receive a discounted price and only pay $15 for any additional tickets.  The discount code password will be "NYCDads" for this reduced price.

* Tickets are FREE for NYC Dads Group Members


* By RSVPing, you will be getting one ticket for the dad + 1 ticket for a child = 2 tickets.

*Please only RSVP for this show if you're serious about attending.  We don't want anyone to miss out on this free and exciting opportunity and want all tickets to be used. 

* For additional children or significant others, pay discounted admission price of $15 for each individual ticket. Discount code for reduced price at checkout is "NYCDads"

* We will be providing a list of names of all RSVP's to Symphony Space.  You will be picking up your tickets at the "Will Call" after 10am on day of performance.

* Meet-and-greet  - A special hello from Justin and his band after the show - photo opp and meet-and-greet  + A free Justin Roberts song MP3 

Here is a show description:

Justin Roberts… Unplugged! show on November 14th at 11 am


In this rare and intimate concert, Justin will perform his hits acoustically with arrangements rarely heard in his more pop-rock oriented shows.  With a style compared to Elvis Costello and Green Day, Justin is an audience favorite at Symphony Space every season. This twice GRAMMY Award-nominated artist dishes out intelligent and whimsical songs delving into the highs and lows of everyday experience. Indeed, Entertainment Weeklyrecommends Justin as “a master of conjuring up images that resonate with the young ones.” People says that his songs are “laugh out loud funny,” the New York Times calls the lyrics “witty, smart, raw,” and the Chicago Tribune puts him “in a league of his own.” 

Link: http://www.symphonyspace.org/event/8956/Family/justin-robertsunplugged

Special "unplugged" video - 

https://youtu.be/ON96pHK40z8


Justin's website: 

www.justinrobertsmusic.com



 Symphony Space "Just Kidding" - Planning Saturdays with the kids is easy with Just Kidding! Featuring the very best in family-friendly music, theatre, dance and a whole lot more – all the cultural riches and inspiring experiences that affirm why you raise your kids in New York City
results.how_to_find_us: At "will call" at box office
results.name: NYC Dads & Kids at Symphony Space: Justin Roberts Unplugged + Meet & Greet

group.name: New York City (NYC) Dads Meetup Group

results.description:
Hola amigos!

Our group have received a special invitation to watch some fascinating films by Delia Ackerman, a Peruvian-based documentarian at The New School. The films explore the remarkable people, landscapes and stories of Peru. Delia Ackerman will be present for Q &A and she will meet with our group. The films are in Spanish with English subtitles. This is a great opportunity to learn about Peruvian culture, meet interesting people, practice Spanish and make new amigos.

WHEN: Saturday, Nov 14th

TIME: 11:15 am (Screenings start at 11:30 am)

WHERE: 66 West 12 St. Room A404, Fourth Floor


Admission is free

After the screening and the Q & A session with the film director, the group will go to a Peruvian restaurant in the area to have lunch.
results.name: PERUVIAN FILM RETROSPECTIVE + Peruvian Lunch

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.how_to_find_us: we will be on the field!!!

results.description:
REGISTER FOR FREE

￼ Gain personalized advice and meet the world’s top b-schools

Fed up of the endless scrolling through school rankings websites?

Do you have at least 3 year’s work experience?


Want to attend one-to-one sessions with admissions directors who can answer all of your MBA questions? How about a personalized conversation with the business school of your choice? 

Save the date and register now:http://goo.gl/m9Bsiw

At the event, you can gain:

Access to top business schools in one room

Tailored personal schedule of 30 minute meetings based both on yours and the schools criteria

A pre-screened matching service that lets us identify which schools best suit your needs

Face-to-face meetings with business school admissions directors

In-depth information on a variety of MBA programs

Access to scholarships worth $1.7 million

Additionally, registration entitles us to a free consultation from their team of MBA experts

Participating MBA schools include:

Baruch College - Zicklin School of Business Administration, City University of New York

Brandeis International Business School

Hult International Business School

IE Business School

University of California, Irvine-Merage School

University of Miami - MBA Programs

University of Minnesota - Carlson School of Management

University of South Carolina, Darla Moore School of Business

University of Toronto Joseph L. Rotman School of Management

Entry is free for members of this meet up, but places are limited so make sure you Register today. 

Once you have registered, a member of the Connect 1-2-1 team will be in touch with you to arrange the meetings with the schools.

See you there!

We are on Twitter! Follow @TopMBAand use #QSMBAtour to join the conversation, get in touch with our team and meet other MBA candidates!
results.name: QS MBA EVENT - Personalized Advice & Meet World’s Top B-Schools

results.description:
Experience all the American Museum of Natural History has to offer and at the same time, meet fun new people and make some new friends! 

Don't miss our last Museum Meetup of the year! Tix here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Nov-14-2015_at_1200PM 

The tour starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

We'll have a dedicated tour guide for our group that will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum’s treasures. Afterwards, we will experience some of the fantastic shows. 

Your ticket includes:

12pm-1:30pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:30pm - Imax Movie

4:30pm - Special Exhibit   

Tickets start at just $45.75 (limited # available, price will go up to $55.75 as event gets closer)

*MUST PREPAY HERE (TIX WON'T BE SOLD AT DOOR) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Nov-14-2015_at_1200PM

*NOTE:  You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 1:30. If you arrive after 1:30 you will not be able to find the group.

This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. It is also not ethnic specific. It is a multi-group event and all are welcome.  

Why RSVP says +40? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be about 50 members attending and this will sell out!

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Nov-14-2015_at_1200PM
results.how_to_find_us: Pre-Mingle location will be sent to you after ticket is purchased, closer to event date

results.description:
We will be doing creative exercises to raise your positive energy levels! This will be followed by discussion about the meaning and purposes of empowerment. This is led by two life coaches, and we had invited others interested in human potential to attend--other life coaches, psychologists, spiritual workers, and ordinary people who want to live as good, healthy, and vibrant life! You are invited too!

Since its lunchtime, bring your own lunch and lets chow as we meet!

Cosponsored with Life & Business Growth Meetup: http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Empowered-Life-and-Business-Growth/

Yours truly,
Leon Tsao, MA
Daniel Speiss
results.name: Empowerment Exercises & Discussion

venue.name: Pearl Studios

results.description:
We the Authentic Steppers of Connecticut/Bklyn have added another Sophisticated Partner Style Dance to our Chicago Style Steppin Classes.

It is called Detroit Urban Style Ballroom!

Under the mentoring and Instruction of Master Ballroom Instructor from "Charlotte Purple Steppers" Demond Carter, we will be bringing this fun . easy and Sophisticated Partner Style dance to the Tri-state area.

We will have returning Instructors June/Audrey from the Philly Phive visiting us again!

There will be instruction in the Fundamental basics of the dance in a way that will get you moving and executing moves with comfort your very first class!

For those with previous Ballroom Experience, this will give you the opportunity to increase your repetoire,  and perfect mechanics.

We recommend (but don't require) that women wear comfortable shoes with a slight heel and that the Gents wear leather soled shoes.

$10pp

No partner necessary

This will be a monthly class until interest and attendance build and then we will meet more often. Location may change from month to month depending on studio availability and the desire to be inclusive of the Tri-state areas. So please follow us and our meetup updates. RSVP is encouraged and helpful to your hosts.

New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, Please join us!
results.how_to_find_us: A,C, 1,2,3 to 34th Street. Between 35th and 36th Street
results.name: DETROIT URBAN BALLROOM MEETS THE TRI-STATE

results.description:
Figure Drawing Bootcamp 

Gain more confidence in your figure drawing skills! 

Join New York Academy of Art MFA - Amanda Scuglia for a four-hour Figure Drawing Bootcamp.

This four-hour session will focus on drawing the figure from life. We will work on creating both expression and "likeness" within 20-30 minute poses. 

(This session is for people who have drawn the figure before but who consider themselves advanced beginners or intermediate.)

It is designed to give your drawings a sense of energy while still allowing you to analyze the figure. The result allows more information on the page in a shorter amount of time. 

The session will run as follows: 1. Lesson 2. Demo 3. Exercise (repeating) until the end of the session where we will bring together all the exercises into our final drawings. Amanda will provide guidance throughout. 

We will work from a live model for the entire session in this amazing room!


Material Requirements:

CHARCOAL- a variety of willow and vine- compressed chunky charcoal - charcoal pencils

PAPER- 18 x 24 in sketch pad paper for short poses (please make sure its full to ensure you have enough paper for the entire session)

MATERIALS- Sandpaper stick - kneaded eraser

Amanda Scuglia received her  MFA in Painting- New York Academy of Art, New York, NY. 

She teaches figure drawing at Long Island University of Brooklyn, NY and was visiting professor - Altos De Chavon (Parsons School), Dominican Republic. She also received an Eric Fischl Teaching Residency at West Nottingham Academy, Maryland.
results.name: (Sold Out) Figure Drawing Bootcamp

results.description: We love Japanese food because it's simple, elegant, and healthy, and enjoy speaking the language as well. If you share these common interests, you are more than welcome to join us, because it's going to be a splendid lunch. We will speak Japanese and English. The restaurant is not expensive, so $15-$20 should be enough for you to have a filling and delicious meal.

results.description:
REGISTER FOR FREE 


Gain personalized advice and meet the world’s top b-schools

Fed up of the endless scrolling through school rankings websites? Do you have at least 3 year’s work experience?

Want to attend one-to-one sessions with admissions directors who can answer all of your MBA questions? How about a personalized conversation with the business school of your choice? Save the date and don’t forget to click on the following link to REGISTER FOR FREE as an RSVP on this group does not guarantee entry to the event - http://goo.gl/JfBqmh

Here are two videos that explains the great deal :

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P4AB99H3hak

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8CzqRzsIgdY

At the event, you can gain:

•  Access to top business schools in one room

•  Tailored personal schedule of 30 minute meetings based both on yours and the schools criteria

•  A pre-screened matching service that lets us identify which schools best suit your needs

•  Face-to-face meetings with business school admissions directors

•  In-depth information on a variety of MBA programs

•  Access to scholarships worth $1.7 million

•  Additionally, registration entitles us to a free consultation from their team of MBA experts

Participating MBA schools include:

•  Baruch College - Zicklin School of Business Administration, City University of New York

• Brandeis International Business School

• Hult International Business School

• IE Business School

• University of California, Irvine-Merage School

• University of Miami - MBA Programs

• University of Minnesota - Carlson School of Management

• University of South Carolina, Darla Moore School of Business

• University of Toronto Joseph L. Rotman School of Management

Entry is free for members of this meet up, but places are limited so make sure you Register today. Once you have registered, a member of the Connect 1-2-1 team will be in touch with you to arrange the meetings with the schools.

See you there!

We are on Twitter! Follow @TopMBA and use #QSMBAtour to join the conversation, get in touch with our team and meet other MBA candidates!

results.description:
TO REGISTER FOR FREE: YOU MUST USE THIS EXCLUSIVE LINK:  http://goo.gl/AJQxOe</a>

Gain Personalized Advice and Meet the World’s Top B-Schools

Fed up of the endless scrolling through school rankings websites?

Do you have at least 3 year’s work experience?

Want to attend one-to-one sessions with admissions directors who can answer all of your MBA questions?

How about a personalized conversation with the business school of your choice?

Save the date and register now: http://goo.gl/AJQxOe


At the event, you can gain:

• Access to top business schools in one room

• Tailored personal schedule of 30 minute meetings based both on yours and the school’s criteria

• A pre-screened matching service that lets us identify which schools best suit your needs

• Face-to-face meetings with business school admissions directors

• In-depth information on a variety of MBA programs

• Access to scholarships worth $1.7 million

Additionally, registration entitles us to a free consultation from their team of MBA experts


Participating MBA schools include:

Baruch College - Zicklin School of Business Administration, City University of New York

Brandeis International Business School

Hult International Business School

IE Business School

University of California, Irvine-Merage School

University of Miami - MBA Programs

University of Minnesota - Carlson School of Management

University of South Carolina, Darla Moore School of Business

University of Toronto Joseph L. Rotman School of Management


Entry is FREE for members of this Meetup, but places are limited so make sure you <a href="http://goo.gl/AJQxOe">Register Today.  

• Once you have registered, a member of the Connect 1-2-1 team will be in touch with you to arrange the meetings with the schools.


Looking forward to seeing you there!

Best wishes, Zorka

Zorka Kovacevich

Meetup Networking Organizer

P.S. We are on Twitter! Follow @TopMBA and use #QSMBAtour to join the conversation, get in touch with our team and meet other MBA candidates!

group.name: New York Business Opportunity Seekers and Providers

results.description:
Experience all the American Museum of Natural History has to offer and at the same time, meet fun new people and make some new friends! 

Don't miss our last Museum Meetup of the year! Tix here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Nov-14-2015_at_1200PM 

The tour starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

We'll have a dedicated tour guide for our group that will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum’s treasures. Afterwards, we will experience some of the fantastic shows. 

Your ticket includes:

12pm-1:30pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:30pm - Imax Movie

4:30pm - Special Exhibit   

Tickets start at just $45.75 (limited # available, price will go up to $55.75 as event gets closer)

*MUST PREPAY HERE (TIX WON'T BE SOLD AT DOOR) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Nov-14-2015_at_1200PM

*NOTE:  You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 1:30. If you arrive after 1:30 you will not be able to find the group.

This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. It is also not ethnic specific. It is a multi-group event and all are welcome.  

Why RSVP says +40? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be about 50 members attending and this will sell out!

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Nov-14-2015_at_1200PM
results.how_to_find_us: Pre-Mingle location will be sent to you after ticket is purchased, closer to event date
results.name: Museum of Natural History Private Tour w/ Pre-Mingle (PREPAY ONLY EVENT)

We'll be playing funk this season. Join us for a great time playing in this group. We got the funk of Stevie Wonder, James Brown, Chic, Kool&The Gang, George Clinton and more! 

Acoustic guitars, bass and ukeleles welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (All charts will be posted by end of August) 

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

September 09/05, 09/12, 09/19, 09/26
October 10/03, 10/10, 10/17, 10/24, 10/31 (halloween, boo)
November 11/07, 11/14, 11/21 (skipping Thanksgiving, Happy Thanksgiving!)
December 12/05, 12/12

SUPERSTITION by Stevie Wonder (POSTED)

results.description:
course on a

If you are an international artists or creative professional wanting to work in the US, this Meetup is for you. This Meetup is intended for international creative professional looking to work in the US as freelancers.

CONTEMPORARY ART PRACTICE is an organization that develops tools and resources to support artists and creative professionals develop strong and successful careers.

This Meetup is structure to be a free 1 hour online info session followed by a 2 hours course.

During the info session you will learn:

1. What is an O1 visa? (also known as "Artist Visa")

2. Who is eligible for an O1 visa

3. What documents you need to apply

4. How much does it cost

5. How long does it take to put together

6. How can you build a good case for your application

If after the info session you decide you want to know more, you can stay for our following 2 hour course. We will cover:

1. How to find a sponsor

2. How to reach for recommenders

3. How to write letters of recommendation to fit USCIS requirements

4. How to organize your evidences and build categories

5. How to know if you need a consultation letter from the union related to your field

6. How to find employers

7. How to organize your itinerary

8. What is a deal memo and how it should look like

9. How to organize yourself to get it done as fast and painless as possible

We will dedicate the last half and hour for Q&A so you get clear about all your concerns and questions about this process.

Maximum of 7 people per course.

The first 1 hour info session is Free and the cost of the following course is $250 per person.

You will leave with an action plan under your arm and vast knowledge on how to tackle every task of your application process. You will also have access to an archive of samples of letters of recommendation, deal memo, itineraries and other useful sources to make this process easier and build a strong case for your O1 visa application.

Join us for this Meetup! You will get very valuable information and you will get to meet people to support you along the process.

Special discounts: You can get a 10% if you pay before the day of the course (message us for paying details). Also, if you bring a friend to the course, you get 10% discount for you and 10% for your friend. Also, you organize a group of 5 people and you get the course for FREE!

Can't make it to this date? We teach this course every other Saturday and we also provide one-on-one courses in New York and Online. Visit our website for more details.
results.name: O1 Visa: Working Visa for Artists and Creative Professionals Course in Brooklyn

We will meet at 12:00pm noon in Manhattan outside the Starbucks near the Brooklyn Bridge, you can get there with the 4,5,6, A, C, 2, 3 subways. The 3.5 mile walk should take less than 2 hours, at a normal pace

• You join the meetup at your own risk, organizers are not liable

This event is being organized by Randall's Island Park Alliance, in partnership with the Hudson Valley Orienteering club.

This is a sprint style orienteering course. This means that pace can be faster than forest orienteering, since the park landscape is easier to navigate and quick thinking is of the essence!

There will be a kids course and two adult courses.

TIME: 12:00 p.m.–3:00 p.m.


</a>

<a href="http://www.nycgovparks.org/common_images/events/full/562a5444b48da.jpg">

Join us for an adventure as we unlock Island secrets, search for treasure, and explore Randall’s Island!

Participants will learn how to use a map and compass (all materials provided).

There will be arts and crafts activities, a gallery of maps, light refreshments, and treasure for all who participate. 

All ages are welcome. There's a new adult course!

http://www.nycgovparks.org/parks/randalls-island/events/2015/11/14/the-great-randalls-island-treasure-hunt

results.description:
** This class is for anyone who is completely new to improv and have been afraid to try it out. **

** You're welcome to stay and watch the Ensemble class that's happening right after this class ends. **

Public speaking is a powerful skill to have. And there is a powerful way to build upon and enhance your public speaking presence and have a good laugh at the same time: by learning how to improvise!

Improv takes focus, a willingness to embrace the group dynamic and a commitment to fostering your sense of play.

Dewey Chaffee, a professional comedian and improvisor, will lead you through each of these areas with skill, kindness and most importantly, patience, creating an environment that is safe, comfortable, and creatively inspiring.

Improv will make you a better listener, a more open and accepting communicator in life, and a master at slinging bullshit when you need to appear more confident than you feel on the inside!

More details here: www.PlayWithDewey.com

Anyone and everyone is welcome!

(We prefer that you sign up online, so we can get an accurate head count. If you can only pay in-person, please bring exact change.)

-----------------------------------------------

About Dewey Chaffee

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of TV production.

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show called "The Lady Winifred and Didi Show."
results.name: Basic Improv for Public Speaking

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe. 


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:


2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club Programs or activities.

results.description:
Alright guys, the season for pumpkins, beer and hiking is (slowly) approaching. I'm so excited! This is one of my favorite hikes. It's a four-mile loops with scrambling, waterfalls, rope swings, and really nice views of the Hudson. We may stop for food afterwards as well. There's nothing really in the immediate area, but I'll check to see if anything along 9w looks promising. Like I said in my previous posts, I'll be sticking to this time for the hikes I post this season, with the exception of the Oktoberfest one(that one will be 11am), just to make sure we have time for the festivities. Anyway, here are the details:

The Giant Stairs Area: State Line Length: 4 mi. (includes steep descent, mile-long rock scramble, and a steep climb) Time: 2+ hrs. Map: Map 3 Parking: State Line Lookout Bus Access: See "Point Lookout" hike description on our "Public Transportation" page This is the "hike of hikes" on the Palisades, and we really recommend trying something a little easier first ... the "Stairs" are as much rock scramble as hike, with a very steep ascent at the end—never attempt this hike when it’s wet or icy out! Begin this loop hike at Lookout Inn at State Line Lookout. From here, you can begin by going either south or north. To begin south: Begin at Lookout Inn and go to the ski trail entrance at the northwest corner of the parking area. At your first left, take ski trail "A" which also overlaps with the aqua-blazed Long Path. Follow until it comes to a junction, where you turn left to cross the entrance road to State Line Lookout (use caution here). Continue through the gap in the parapet stones and into the woods. The trail goes down a ravine on stone steps. At the base of the ravine, the aqua Long Path crosses a wooden bridge and then intersects the blue-and-white-blazed Forest View Trail; here you will turn left (east) on the Forest View Trail, taking it down to the river, where it will end at the white-blazed Shore Trail (this descent is very steep). Take the white Shore Trail north about 0.25 mi. to the beginning of the Giant Stairs, a formation created by thousands of rockslides over the eons. You’ll scramble over the rocks for about 1 mi., following the white blazes all the way (some of these, you’ll notice, are in the shape of half-moons—don’t let this throw you). The Shore Trail finally levels off along the river, and goes to Peanut Leap Cascade. After a steep ascent on the white Shore Trail, turn left (south) on the aqua-blazed Long Path, cross the stream, and follow the Long Path back to start. To begin north: Head north along Old Route 9W, noting the aqua blazes of the Long Path along the way—you’ll be following these markers for the first part of this hike. About 100 yd. along, the Long Path leaves the old cement road and goes into the woods, more or less following the cliff edge (and for a while overlapping Ski Trail E). About 1 mi. along, you come to the State Line Monument and a chain link fence; here the trail jogs right (east) to go around the fence, and begins to descend a series of stone steps, with excellent vistas north toward the Tappan Zee. At the base of the steps, the trail jogs to the left, to bear northwest for a time and so headed away from the river. In less than 0.5 mi., you’ll cross a stream on wooden bridges. Across this stream, turn right (east), at the start of the white-blazed Shore Trail that follows the stream toward the river. Just before the river, this trail gets quite steep and is prone to erosion—use caution. You will arrive at river level at the base of Peanut Leap Cascade. Continue on the white-blazed Shore Trail as it heads south along the Hudson, then follow it over the Giant Stairs, finally to the trailhead of the blue-and-white-blazed Forest View Trail. This will lead you steeply back up to the aqua-blazed Long Path. Here, turn right (north), cross the bridge, still going up, and follow the Long Path back to the starting point. http://www.njpalisades.org/hikesChallenging.html#giantStairs and here's the pdf map from that site: http://www.njpalisades.org/pdfs/mapGrayscale.pdf
results.name: Giant Stairs Hike @ State Line Lookout

After a steep ascent on the white Shore Trail, turn left (south) on the aqua-blazed Long Path, cross the stream, and follow the Long Path back to start. To begin north: Head north along Old Route 9W, noting the aqua blazes of the Long Path along the way—you’ll be following these markers for the first part of this hike. About 100 yd. along, the Long Path leaves the old cement road and goes into the woods, more or less following the cliff edge (and for a while overlapping Ski Trail E). About 1 mi. along, you come to the State Line Monument and a chain link fence; here the trail jogs right (east) to go around the fence, and begins to descend a series of stone steps, with excellent vistas north toward the Tappan Zee. At the base of the steps, the trail jogs to the left, to bear northwest for a time and so headed away from the river. In less than 0.5 mi., you’ll cross a stream on wooden bridges. Across this stream, turn right (east), at the start of the white-blazed Shore Trail that follows the stream toward the river. Just before the river, this trail gets quite steep and is prone to erosion—use caution. You will arrive at river level at the base of Peanut Leap Cascade. Continue on the white-blazed Shore Trail as it heads south along the Hudson, then follow it over the Giant Stairs, finally to the trailhead of the blue-and-white-blazed Forest View Trail. This will lead you steeply back up to the aqua-blazed Long Path. Here, turn right (north), cross the bridge, still going up, and follow the Long Path back to the starting point. http://www.njpalisades.org/hikesChallenging.html#giantStairs and here's the pdf map from that site: http://www.njpalisades.org/pdfs/mapGrayscale.pdf
results.name: Giants Stairs Hike @State Line Lookout

group.name: Single Men and Single Women in NYC!!!

results.description:
I am a therapist, divorce mediator, and adjunct professor at NYU with a specialization in eating disorders. I am interested in helping to facilitate a monthly meet-up group to discuss experiences, treatment options, and helpful ideas in dealing with eating disorders of all types. I have years of experience treating bulimia, binge eating, anorexia, and issues of body image, with excellent results.


In addition to seeing patients individually for eating disorders (among other issues), I'm currently forming an ongoing, weekly therapy group for persons with eating disorders who are looking for something more ongoing and intensive. I work on a sliding fee scale, so I will do what I can to make it work for you. My approach is a combination of psychodynamic, cognitive-behavioral, and Buddhist principles, with a healthy dose of compassion and understanding!

Our meetups are held in Union Square, near 12th Street and University Place.

Please give me a call or email me if you think you might be interested in attending the meet-ups or in learning more about individual or group therapy. Space is somewhat limited, so if you are interested, it's best to call or email me right away.


Thank you!


Judie Stein, Ph.D., L.M.S.W.
Director
Stein Mediation & Family Center


(212)[masked]
[masked]

www.steinmediation.com

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

Experience Central Park in a whole new way with our Central Park Scavenger Hunt!  It is a fun way to meet new people or hang out with familiar friends in NYC's Urban Oasis! If you don't have a team we will set you up on one as you set out to find fun and historical things that are already part of the park.  Following the hunt you can join members of the hunt for a bite to eat at a local pub or restaurant.How it works:

-Come alone or with friends to The Firehouse Tavern at 12pm.  We will set up the teams (teams of 5 only)

-Each team will have 90 minutes to find as many clues at they can inside the park (clues will be in historical markers, wildlife, street performers, tourists, fountains, statues, bridges and hidden secrets)

-At the end of the 90 minutes each team will return to The Firehouse Tavern to see which group has uncovered the most clues to win prizes!

Can I come alone?  Yes, 95% of those attending will be coming on their own.  If you come alone we will put you on a team with other fun members.

Dress code:dress for the weather

Is this going to be hard or do I need experience?  No this is a fun hunt and designed to make the clues easy to find.

What if it rains? We will send updates before the event.

How do I pay?  Please bring exact change $10

If you do not see a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be many people attending from other groups, YOU WILL NOT BE ALONE!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Central Park Fall Scavenger Hunt

Don't miss our last Museum Meetup of the year! Tix here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/museumonh/dates/Nov-14-2015_at_1200PM 

The tour starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

We'll have a dedicated tour guide for our group that will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum’s treasures. Afterwards, we will experience some of the fantastic shows. 

Your ticket includes:

12pm-1:30pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:30pm - Imax Movie

4:30pm - Special Exhibit

Why RSVP says +40? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be about 50 members attending and this will sell out!

results.description:
We're very excited to announce our third meetup at the OSA Community Center! This is our furthest Uptown meetup yet. OSA is short for Our Saviour's Attonement (Lutheran Church), however, do not let that dissuade you if you follow a certain religion -our use of the community center is of no religious affiliation! This is a Saturday afternoon of tabletop gaming, welcome to all. Also, Please note that this meetup is starting slightly earlier than our last meetups at this location, and will last one extra hour (5 hours total). RSVP as soon as you can commit, because space is limited to 30 people!

If you haven't attended our other meetups, you can expect to play tabletop games of all sorts; examples include Carcassonne, The Resistance, Castles of Burgundy, Settlers of Catan, Lords of Waterdeep, Agricola, Through the Ages, Magic the Gathering, etc. Feel free to bring any games that you'd like to play with other Uptown Gamers.


Our group is renting this space, so, unlike our other meetups to date, I will have to collect an 8 dollar contribution upon attendance. This will be a good venue for our group because we will not feel obligated to buy food or drinks as we do when we have events at bars/restaurants. The good news, though, is that we are allowed to bring food and (non-alcoholic) beverages into the space, as long as we clean up after ourselves.


Our space will be through the southern entrance, and up the stairs in the balcony room. The space is well lit, and has nice folding tables and chairs which will be very conducive to table top gaming. As I mentioned before, the space is limited to 30 people, so I'd ask that you do not RSVP unless you are reasonably certain that you can attend -this is also important because of the contributions that we'll need to collect in order to keep renting this center.

As always, Uptown Gamers Unite!
results.name: Tabletop games at OSA Community Center!

results.description:
Come join us for a new adventure at two historical parks in Yonkers! Its' a feast for the eyes! Sara Kelsey co-head  of walks and tours for the Friends of the Old Croton Aqueduct will be our guide and historian!

                                                  photos from on line

A fee of $5 per person will be collected which will  go to "The Friends of the Old Croton Aqueduct org." and their ongoing restorations, a most worthy endeavor! This also entitles you to a map of either the NYC or Westchester side of the Croton Aqueduct.  Meet at the Lenoir Nature Preserve at 19 Dudley Street in Yonkers, off of Broadway, at 12:30. Rest rooms available. 

 Heading south on the grounds of the Preserve and Old Croton Aqueduct Trail Sara will be taking us to Untermyer Gardens for a tour of these exquisite Gardens, once among the most famous gardens in the world!  We will return to the Lenoir Preserve on the Old Croton Aqueduct.  For more info call Sara at [masked]-1448.

We will be walking and hiking on dirt paths, some grass, a steep stairway and woods trails with some moderate ups and downs approx. (6 miles approx.2 1/2 hours). This will be at a moderate pace with stops along the way for photos and a little history by our host Sara Kelsey! 

 Hiking shoes or boots are recommended along with hiking poles, WATER, snacks and cameras of course! Dress in layers.  JUST A REMINDER DOGS ARE NOT ALLOWED ON THESE GROUNDS OR ON ANY HIKE UNLESS DESIGNATED. 

For more info about Untermeyer Gardens go to http://www.untermyergardens.org/the-latest.html

Possible dinner after at the El Dorado West Diner located at 460 S.Broadway, Tarrytown, Giannas at 1034 N.Broadway, La Lanterna at 23 Gray Oaks Ave.  or another venue to be determined if there is enough interest. 

DIRECTIONS TO THE LENOIR NATURE PRESERVE FROM ROCKLAND COUNTY: 

Take the TZ bridge to 287 E / 87 S to Exit 7A the Saw Mill Pkwy South.

Go approx. 5.8 miles and turn right on Executive Blvd go  .9 mile

Turn Right on N. Broadway / US 9N and go .3 mi

Take your first left onto Dudley St. and the center will be on your left shortly. 

THIS IS FROM MAPQUEST, PLEASE LEAVE YOURSELF EXTRA TIME WHEN FINDING A NEW PLACE AND IT IS ALWAYS HELPFUL TO DO SOME RESEARCH ON YOUR OWN AND HAVE ALTERNATE ROUTES AVAILABLE. 

Carpool option from Untermyer Gardens at 945 No.Broadway, Yonkers, for those who want a shorter jaunt. 

INCLEMENT WEATHER CANCELS. ALWAYS CHECK THE DAY OF AN EVENT FOR POSSIBLE CHANGES.
