results.description:
This is my second year attending this valuable program. Under Lee Reiser, ACA level ll instructor, will help you hone your existing skills, learn new ones properly and introduce new people to the world of kayaking. In a beautiful heated pool with all kayaks and gear provided you can train for 2 hours learning bracing, rolling, rescues etc. and in return help the public for 2 hours by setting up and putting equipment away, greeting the public students, assisting instructors etc. All level of kayakers are welcome. The sessions are as follows:
Course 1 Saturday - Nov. 14, 21; Dec. 5, 12, 2015
Course 2 " - Jan. 9, 16, 23, 30, 2016
Course 3 " - Feb. 6, 13, 27; March 5, 2016


         The time for volunteers to practice is from 3 to 4 pm, and the time to volunteer is from 4 to 6 pm. Please arrive at least 15 minutes before so you can get ready. Pack a small bag with your change of clothes. The pool is heated but you may want to wear a wet suit, bringing your own PFD, paddle and skirt can add to your comfort level. Nose, ear plugs and goggles are helpful for rolling practice.  Pack a small bag with a change of clothes, towel etc. and bring a lock for the lockers.


Please fill out the volunteer packet which can be obtained from the Yonkers Club site: http://www.yprc.org
click on the Riverbank link once you are in the site and download the NY community Kayak Program packet. If you commit to at least 1 session you will be provided with a parking pass. If you are attending contact Audrey Jackson, Program Coordinator at:  [masked]

        DIRECTIONS-  From 138th St. head west and make a left onto 12th Ave., Take the 1st right beneath the West Side Hwy (by the restaurant) then swing right again past the first guard booth. Follow the roadway in and around, curve left and make a hard left U-turn into the parking area. Use the elevator to get to the park on the upper level walk to the pool area. Make sure you have a parking permit in your car window. Please car pool as parking is limited.

Riverbank State Park

Information For Volunteers

Fall 2015 I Winter 2016

New York Community Kayak Program

Fall 2015 I Winter 2016

ABOUT THE PROGRAM

The NYC Community Kayak Pool Program will begin at Riverbank State Park on Saturday, November 15, 2014 and

runs through the beginning of March 7, 2015. The program provides basic kayak training to the public through the

New York State Department of Parks in an Olympic size pool overlooking the Hudson River. These weekly

classes are to introduce students to kayak equipment and learn basic strokes and safety. The program relies on

instructors / volunteers from the kayak community.

Head Instructor Lee Reiser donates his time throughout the season. Lee is an ACA Level II

Certified Instructor. He are assisted by individuals with a wide range

of experience and certifications from the American Canoe Association and the British Canoe Union, two of the

major organizations for the sport of recreational kayaking.

PUBLIC KAYAK COURSES

Riverbank State Park promotes the program and

enrolls students in one of the six courses we hold. Each

course contains four classes. These weekly classes are

held on Saturdays from 4 to 6 pm. The curriculum will

cover basic skills using the ACA skill level I guidelines.

The age and experience level of the public students can

vary greatly. A student can be an adult or a child,

comfortable in the water or anxious about learning. We

break down into smaller groups so that each student gets

instruction tailored to their needs. This requires a lot of

volunteers and that's where you can help and learn at the

same time!

VOLUNTEERING

All kayakers are invited to volunteer, even beginners. Volunteers help out by setting up equipment, greeting the public

students, assisting Instructors and stowing gear at the end of each class.

In exchange for their service, volunteers are given training and pool time from 3 to 4 pm on Saturdays (prior to the

public classes). Volunteers may arrive at 2;45pm.You may practice your skills and learn new techniques from the

Instructors and other Volunteers, such as bracing, rolling, rescues and towing. For those interested in certification,

Lee Reiser will provide ACA Skills Level I & II training with an opportunity to receive ACA certification at the

completion of training. Certifications are held off site from the pool on a date, time, and place that will be announced.

We may also have a variety of guest speakers in the paddling community to better inform you of different groups to

paddle with and local options for paddling. These speakers and opportunities for networking in the paddling

community will be emailed by our Program Coordinator in brief messages.

Courses Dates

Course 1 Saturday November 14, 21,

December 5,12

Course 2 Saturday January 9, 16, 23, 30

Course 3 Saturday February 6, 13, 27

March 5

New York Community Kayak Program

Fall 2015 I Winter 2016

VOLUNTEER ELIGIBILITY

We are guests of Riverbank State Park and, as such, must adhere to their rules. There are also a few more

dictated by our insurance coverage. Please ...

• Sign/Check in at the front desk when you enter the Aquatic Center

• Sign into the waiver/attendance sheet at the start of each session.

• Read, sign, and agree to adhere to the Program Rules and Code of Conduct at the beginning of the season

• Follow instructions and orders from Pool personnel, Lifeguards as well as program staff

• Bring an adult with you to each class if you are under 18 years old, this person would need to sign the waiver/

attendance sheet for the participant that is not at least 18 years old.

.

GETTING TO RIVERBANK STATE PARK

The park overlooks the Hudson River on the west side of Manhattan. Located at 679 Riverside Drive, it spans

from 137th Street to 145th Street. For information call the park at (212)[masked] or via the web at

http://nysparks.state.ny.us/parks/93/details.aspx

The Aquatic Center is located on the west side of the football field overlooking the Hudson River. From the

traffic circle head toward the skating rink. Enter the main building, where you will immediately walk through

and exit on the other side; follow the pathway around the west side of the football field, towards the Hudson

River and the Aquatic Center.

Via Mass Transit: Take #1 train to 145th Street and walk west towards the Hudson River - after crossing

Riverside Drive you will see the main entrance to the park. Follow the pathway into the park and towards the football

field.

Optionally you may take the #1 train to 137th Street and proceed west towards the Hudson river after crossing

Riverside Drive follow the pathway to the large building on the west side of the track / football field.

The M11 bus in Manhattan, and the BX19 bus in the Bronx will take you directly to the park and drop you

off in the traffic circle adjacent to the skating rink.

By Car: From 138th Street head west and make a left onto 12th Avenue. Take the first right beneath the

West Side Highway (by the restaurant) then swing right again past the first guard booth. Follow the

roadway in and around, curve left then make a hard left u-turn into the parking area. Use the elevator or

stairs to get to the park on the upper level and proceed to the traffic circle.

From the West Side Highway: Take the 125th Street exit, make the first left past Fairway Supermarket and

double back on 12th Avenue. Take a left under the highway overpass (just before the restaurant) then swing

right past the first guard booth. Follow the roadway, curve left then make a hard left u-turn into the parking

area. Use the elevator or stairs to get to the park on the upper level and proceed to the traffic circle.

New York Community Kayak Program

Fall 2015 I Winter 2016

PARKING

The driving directions provided take you to the permit parking area. There are a limited number of spaces for

Instructors and Volunteers. If you plan to attend at least four classes we will provide you with a permit. Please

show the permit to the attendant and display it on your dashboard when at the park.

Under no circumstances are cars permitted to park outside of this area. Vehicles left at or near the traffic circle

may be ticketed and towed at the owner's expense. However, you may drop off and pick up passengers within

the traffic circle via the 145th Street entrance to the park.

WHAT WE PROVIDE

We will use decked kayaks of assorted sizes; most of these are whitewater and play boats, and river kayaks.

Space does not permit the use of full size sea kayaks. We also provide adult and child paddles, life vests and

spray skirts. A few pumps, paddle floats, tow lines and other rescue gear are available to practice rescues.

Optional: You may bring your own paddle, life vest and spray skirt provided they are washed in fresh water before

entering the pool. If you are interested in bringing in your own boat please check out the size of the pool first and

speak with one of the program staff to discuss this option.

WHAT TO BRING

Don't forget to bring a padlock so you can lock up your valuables and clothes.

Bring a towel, swimsuit and other approved water gear to wear in the pool, such as a wetsuit, water

shorts and rash guard. Non-approved clothing, such as T-shirts, cutoff jeans, and leotards, etc. is not

permitted in the pool.

Flip-flops or other footwear that has never been worn on the street may be worn around the pool area.

Street shoes are not permitted.

You may want to bring nose plugs, ear plugs and swim goggles for rolling practice. Masks the cover the nose, such

as snorkel or scuba masks, are NOT permitted. However a pair of goggles with a nose clip attached to the strap is

acceptable

WHEN YOU ARRIVE

• You may enter the Aquatic Center 15 minutes in advance of each day's class - please arrive no earlier than

2:40 pm on Saturdays.

• Sign in with the Attendant at the Aquatics Reception Desk. It’s a plain looking desk but sign in as an

Instructor / Volunteer. A list of participants will be printed so just sign next to your name. If your name is not

there fill your name at the bottom and it will add it for the following weeks.

• Proceed to the locker room to change and secure your belongings. Enter the pool area to assist in setting up

the boats and gear. You must also sign in the waiver/attendance sheet at the start on the pool side.

Essentially you sign in twice, once at the front desk and then a second time once you get pool side.

• All participants are supposed to shower prior to entering the pool, which is quite different from showing

before you enter the pool area.

New York Community Kayak Program

Fall 2015 I Winter 2016

OUR SPONSORS AND SUPPORTERS

Equipment and monetary support has been provided by numerous clubs and individuals. We thank our past sponsors

and look forward to their ongoing support - we can't do it without them! Please join us in recognizing their effort.

• Gowanus Dredgers Canoe Club & Owen Foote: for generously providing insurance last

season and sponsoring the program yet again this season

• Long Island City Community Boathouse and the Gowanus Dredgers: for the loan of paddles and

PFDs

• The Downtown Boathouse: for providing various small kayaks to be utilized in our program

• Andy Laiosa: for the use of various small kayaks suitable to our program;

• Jerry Blackstone and Lee Reiser: for the use of kayaks, skirts, pumps, paddle floats and other

miscellaneous equipment.

STILL HAVE QUESTIONS?

Please send an email to Audrey Jackson. Program Coordinator [masked] or

Lee Reiser [masked]

READY TO VOLUNTEER?

results.description:
Hope your Indigenous Peoples Day is going well!

Our next CMA meetup will focus on aspects...

"In astrology, an aspect is an angle the planets make to each other in the horoscope, and also to the ascendant, midheaven, descendant, lower midheaven, and other points of astrological interest. Aspects are measured by the angular distance in degrees and minutes of ecliptic longitude between two points, as viewed from Earth. According to astrological tradition, they indicate the timing of transitions and developmental changes in the lives of people and affairs relative to the Earth." (Wikipedia)

Bring your natal chart, as it will help to keep yourself relevant to the discussion. Also, feel free to bring any books or reference materials that you think will aid in the dialogue.

Here are some sites that you can use to draw up your natal chart:

http://astromatrix.org/Astrology/BirthChart#/Get?constraints=8&type=birthchart


http://astro.cafeastrology.com/cgi-bin/astro/natal

See you next month!

results.description:
Slip. Trip. Fall. Thud. You laugh it off as you just failed miserably, learning to ice skate for the first time. You find yourself looking up to a hand that's reaching out for yours, helping you up. This hand has a familiar warmth to it. You look again. Of course. It's another Recent College Grad. You both smile as you brush off the snow that's clinging for dear life on your ass and pretend as if that didn't just happen.

It's another Social Saturday: Ice Skating Edition! Come join the Recent College Grads (21-28) for a jolly good time as we ice skate (or try our best to) at the Winter Village in Bryant Park.

Enjoy the crisp, cool breezes of Autumn whisk past your cheeks as you glide along the smooth and polished ice below with your fellow grads. Or for those who aren't as skate-savvy, take comfort in the fact that you have friends here who you can rely on to fall "gracefully" with.

All skill levels are welcome (including those without any), as we're here for each other's company - not the Olympics.

Event Location:

Bank of America Winter Village at Bryant Park
W 42nd St and 6th Ave
New York, NY 10018
Theater District, Midtown West

Pricing:

General Admission: Free
Skate Rental: $15

For more pricing information, click here: Bank of America Winter Village at Bryant Park | Pricing and Special Rates


Nearby Train Stations:

- 42nd Street - Bryant Park via B,D,F,M Train
- 5th Avenue via 7 Train
- Times Square - 42nd Street via S(Shuttle) Train

Where to Find Us:

We'll meet at the staircase past "Wafels & Dingles" and "Breads Bakery" on the corner of 6th Avenue and 42nd Street.

Contact Information:

If you have any questions, feel free to call/text Anthony at: (917) 526-3750.

P.S. - Lockers are free but lock purchases will cost $9. Save some money by bringing in your own lock. If you own your own skates, admission is free as well.

results.description:
Have you tried DakGalbi(Spicy Grilled Chicken)?

Dakgalbi, also romanized dalkgalbi, is a popular Korean dish generally made by stir-frying marinated diced chicken in a gochujang (chili pepper paste) based sauce, and sliced cabbage, sweet potato, scallions, onions, perilla leaves, and tteok (rice cake) together on a hot plate. It is a local specialty food for the city of Chuncheon, Gangwon Province, where dakgalbi originates. Because of its origin, the dish is also called Chunchŏn dak galbi

results.description:
WHAT IS NYZ?

NYZ Apocalypse is a unique interactive zombie survival experience. The apocalypse begins in an underground top secret prison system, where inmates and staff infected with a deadly infectious virus terrorize the living. Over the course of about 45 minutes, you will be briefed, trained and thrust into the Apocalypse, where you must face down the infected, re-arm yourself and interact with any known survivors. NYZ Apocalypse is a frightening experience, and we therefore only recommend those 16 years or older to enter. 

THE EXPERIENCE

NYZ Apocalypse is an interactive live-action theatrical production, where you decide your fate. Equipped with gas recoil laser weapons, your group will enter the Apollo Prison System and fight back hundreds of zombies. At NYZ, you can only survive the Apocalypse by working as a team. Make sure the zombies don't get close enough to "infect" you, and be sure to interact with the guards and personel inside the prison network to reload your weapons. From the moment you arrive at NYZ, you will be a part of the story. For a totally immersive and truly memorable experience, leave your ego at the door. 

THE WEAPONS

At NYZ Apocalypse, you will be equipped with a full weight laser rifle. Utilizing a unique gas-recoil system, these weapons fire an infrared laser beam accurate up to 500 yards. Nothing but a harmless beam of light is fired form these guns, and no form of protective gear is required. Conserving your shots, reloading and finding spare ammunition will all be necessary throughout the Apollo Prison System.

Date: November 14th Saturday; please arrive 15 minutes earlier.


Depart 3:45 PM: (Garden City Deli) Corner of 43rd St and 9th Ave New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Depart 4:30 PM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel) [masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map).

Return: Depart from NYZ after dinner at 8:30 PM and get back to Flushing at around 9:30 PM & Manhattan 10:00 PM.

Cost: Early birds $59 for first 8 spots or 10 days in advance; afterward Regular $69.

Trip includes: Round trip Benz Sprinter van transportation from NYC, Extermination Package & service fee.

Buy Ticket Here: http://nov2015nyzapocalypse.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me the amount indicated above to [masked] to avoid transaction fee (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment is received.

Maximum: 15

Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $10 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance;
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show; however, you can transfer your spot to other with $10 transfer fee.
* 100% refund if the trip is cancelled due to bad weather or vendor close down.

By RSVPing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NYC Active Young Singles.
results.name: NYZ Apocalypse: Zombie Survival Experience + Transport

Hi everyone!

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up. Also, please bring a white t-shirt, a red t-shirt, lots of water and be ready to have fun!

We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map.


If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!


Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

No ball hogging

The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:Field F in Central Park  can be accessed from west 97th street or east 97th street on either side Central Park. We also created a map of the field location since it can be tricky to find: Field Location Map

Directions: By train: From the West side take the B or C to 96th street stop. From the east side take the 6 train to 96th street stop St.

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals: If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee: Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring: A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. Please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds: If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for a future game. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will receive an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has openned up:). Please RSVP as soon as you get that e-mail since everyone on the waiting list will get the same e-mail. The first person who RSVP's takes the spot! Also check our Calendar for other games

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Hi all,

We had a great Drum Circle in October at Cherry Hill in Central Park (for photos, downloadable .wav files, and video on YouTube see links at the bottom of this invite). The date for our next Earth Drum Circle will be Saturday, November 14th. We look forward to seeing all that can make it! Please reply to let us know if you plan on attending the Circle.

DRAGON

P. S. If you need to contact me the day of this event you can reach me at: H: (212)[masked] or Cell: (917) 597-5801.

When: Saturday, November 14th at 4:00 p.m.

Where: Casa de Dragón, 5057 Broadway, Apt. #2, Inwood, NY.

What to Bring: Yourself (feel free to bring friends along), your drum (if drumming), and any other percussion or other instruments (adds to the mix). BTW, If you do not have a drum but want to drum come on up, I have plenty of extra drums here!

Food and Drink for Potluck: Please try to bring some food and or drink to share as we are tying to make the Drum Circles more of a potluck to sustain our drumming energies!!!

Public Transportation to Inwood

Take the #1 train to the 215th Street Station. (Don't miss your stop, the next one is in the Bronx) If you get on the train in the fourth car from the front it will put you right at the exit doors when you get off the train. Once down the stairs I am 1 block West of the train station. Just walk from 10th Avenue (where the train stops) to Broadway. (Away from the Department of Sanitation.) Cross to the far side of Broadway and I am the first building on the right. (Just North of the Deli - Between 215th and 216th Streets)

The A Train:
Take the A train to the 207th Street station. Make sure you get on the train at front two cars which will let you exit at 211th Street and Broadway. Walk 4 blocks North on Broadway to 215th Street on the West side of the street. I am the first building just past 215th Street. (Just North of the Deli - Between 215th and 216th Streets)

results.description:
November, 14th @ 4:30pm

Heal. Transform. Nourish.

“As I continued breathing as deeply and fully as I could, I entered into a non-ordinary state of consciousness where I experienced the full range of memories and emotions that had been repressed for a lifetime. This period was followed by the most blissful state of oneness, beauty and clarity that I had ever known, a profoundly spiritual experience that is beyond words. This is all I’ll say about it here.” Michael C.

The process itself uses very simple means: with the eyes closed and lying on a mat, each person uses their own breath with this technique along with the music in the room to enter a non-ordinary state of consciousness. This state activates the natural inner healing process of the individual’s psyche, bringing him or her a particular set of internal experiences. With the inner healing intelligence guiding the process, the quality and content brought forth is unique to each person and for that particular time and place. While recurring themes are common, no two sessions are ever alike.

Many practitioners feel this breath work provides a direct, replicable, physical experience of Divine Love through the saturation of the body with prana.

$30 per person.

Pre-registration Necessary:
Sign up on Stanton Street Yoga’s page: https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=26254
results.name: Transformational Breathwork

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

4:30 - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
4:45 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on.
5:00 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
6:00 - Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like.

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Milk and Honey Cafe located at 1119 Newkirk Ave. The closest train station is Newkirk Plaza on the Q line. Walk 3 block down Newkirk Avenue until you reach Westminster Road. We are sitting at the table in the back.

SOME TIPS:

Laptops are welcome. Remember to charge your laptop ahead of time.

Please buy something to support this organic cafe. It would make the owner smile.

Come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

results.description:
$10 Suggested Min. Donation per participating child (see addtl. info below).


This is a fundraiser event to support "Save the Children". Additional registration on Eventbrite is required! After your RSVP, please complete your registration by proceeding to

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/event-st-martins-lantern-walk-tickets-18945390172

What is it?

Every November, the German-speaking community of Brooklyn and beyond meets at dusk for their beloved Lantern Walk through beautiful Prospect Park. Children and their families come from all over the New York metro area, equipped with their often handmade glowing lanterns. After singing the traditional songs they follow a procession through the park to watch a reenactment of St. Martin on horseback, sharing his cloak with the beggar.


Donations / Save the Children

In the spirit of St. Martin this event is a fundraiser to benefit a different charity every year.

This year they chose the “Save the Children” as our partner. Our goal is to raise at least $2,000. Please support us generously!

Minimum suggested donation is $10 per child. It is much needed and well appreciated!

How do I get lanterns for my children?

There will be lanterns, lights & sticks available for sale at the event, unless of course, you bring your own, then you can use that one.

How do I get there by subway?

F: 7th Ave (in Brooklyn) - 1 long block

D/N/R: 9th Street - 5 long blocks away (F is much better)

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

11/14: 5:30-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.name: A Conversation About Happiness, Citicorp at 53rd and Lex.

results.description:
The new format lives on: 50/50 Co-Ed Games. We'll open up 12 spots for men and 12 spots for women. And each team will have at least 2 women playing on the court at all times.

Other than that, the idea will be basically the same:

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games: 1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.
results.name: 50/50 Women's Signup

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

results.description:
Every November, the German-speaking community of Brooklyn and beyond meets at dusk for our beloved Lantern Walk through beautiful Prospect Park. Children and their families come from all over the New York metro area, equipped with their often handmade glowing lanterns. After singing the traditional songs we follow a procession through the park to watch a reenactment of St. Martin on horseback, sharing his cloak with the beggar.

This event is free of charge, however, please register in advance, so we can plan accordingly. In the spirit of St. Martin this event is a fundraiser for worthy causes. This year we are fundraising for:


This year we chose the World Wide Orphans Fund as our partner. Our goal is to raise at least $2,000. Please support us generously!

Minimum suggested donation is $10 per child. Thank you!

There will be lanterns and electric tea lights for sale at the event.
results.name: Laternenlaufen - St. Martin in Prospect Park

results.description:
Today we will be focused and immersive in a  specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will focus on drawing figures from or influenced by Greek Mythology. From heroic heroes, to mythical monstrosities, and Lastly the many and divine Gods we will each be assigned the task to recreate one of these!

The meetup will be split into three parts: First sketches and warm-up exercises/conceptual discussion, then an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused!

Also if you'd like to share anything such as art or reference books with the group relating to the theme I urge you to bring them!

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!
results.name: Lets Draw! Greek Mythology: Heroes, Monsters, and Gods!

That will take you to SPG’s shopping cart.
Then, click on “Indoor Play, Food & Beverages,” and follow the instructions. Option 2: mail a check payable to "SPG Tennis" to the address below by Wednesday, November 11. results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
Let's go for something fun and different, let's attend CUUC's annual fundraiser which is a Moroccan themed dinner, with music, drinks, silent and live auction, dancing and fun!  $40 gets you in, and you can bid on items or participate in the raffles.. All of which supports a great organization!  When?  on Saturday November 14th starting at 5:30 at the Community Unitarian Universalist Congregation located just south of White Plains.  

What is Unitarian Universalists?  Community Unitarian Universalist Congregation (CUUC) is a welcoming congregation committed to affirming and purposefully including all regardless of age, race, ethnicity, national origin, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, and sexual or affectional orientation.

We nurture each other in our spiritual journeys, foster compassion and understanding within and beyond our community, and engage in service to transform ourselves and our world. For more info - go to:http://www.cucwp.org/

Tickets available: RSVP Online 

Tickets: $40 per person.
50/50 Raffle Tickets: $20 each, or 6 for $100.    
Grab Bag Raffle Tickets: $3 single, $20/10, $40/25, $100/75.    
Wine Grab: $20 each.

If I come to the Auction, am I expected to spend a certain amount of money?

NO!  You can come to the auction and just enjoy the delicious dinner, drinks and dessert that are included in your ticket price.  Or, if you want to participate on a small scale, you can spend as little as $20 for a wine raffle to win a bottle of equal or greater value, or $25 to purchase a sheet of Grab Bag tickets, and then use those tickets to try to win all sorts of prizes - from new, custom-made jewelry to gift cards for your favorite local stores. So come and socialize with other CUUC members in a festive atmosphere, and spend as little - or as much- as they want.

I have never bid during a live auction. Do I have to do that?

NO!  The live auction is just one small part of our evening.  We also have a silent auction, a Bid and Bump Board, and a Grab Bag table - something for everyone.

I don’t know many people at CUUC yet.  Who will I sit with?

Our seating is open, in long continuous tables, with everyone mixing at each table. No one sits alone and everyone mingles and we are a really friendly group. This is a fun way to meet new people in our community!

Just what is this Bid and Bump Board I have been hearing about?

The Bid and Bump Board is a creative and very entertaining event that allows people to bid on tickets to dinners and other social events held throughout the year by our members. The dinners  are often themed and include both casual and fancy options, with a wide range of prices.  Some examples include a wine tasting event, a poker night, a sunset dinner on the river, or an evening of high-cuisine from France or Italy. The best part of these dinners is that they provide more opportunities throughout the year to socialize with CUUC friends, old and new. Not sure how to bid? Just watch the fun for a few minutes and you’ll catch right on. Is this a fancy event?

No. Many people get creative and dress for the theme of the auction, and the sanctuary is beautifully transformed for the evening. Costumes are part of the fun but totally optional – casual dress is fine.

So.. no one is going to preach to you -- UU is not like that.. everyone is very friendly, and the price is right - and for those who are seeking community - this may be the place for you! I know it is working for me..  Hope to see you there! 

NO RSVP Fee for this one...  but do purchase your tickets online - using the link above..

They are giving away so much stuff that its foolish not to attend! Just the free SUGARBUSH MTN. lift ticket... See details below, get your tickets, meet for dinner. 

Warren Miller’s 

newest 2015 film,

Chasing Shadows, 

to Symphony Space, 95th and Broadway NYC, on Saturday, November 14, 2015 for two shows: 6:00 pm and 9:00 pm. You may go to either event to fit your schedule, however we'll attend the 9pm viewing. 

All attendees will receive free lift ticket vouchers 

(some restrictions apply) to

 Sugarbush. 

Attendees also receive Warren Miller’s

Snow World Magazine

 and a year’s free subscription to 

Ski Magazine

. There will also be a raffle give away for some great prizes. Warren Miller once said,

 “A pair of skis are the ultimate transportation to freedom,” 

and in this year’s film, 

Chasing Shadows

, skiers and snowboarders find that very freedom as they chase storms, snow and lines on the world’s highest peaks.  Follow the world’s biggest names in skiing and snowboarding on a breathtaking cinematic journey. Watch JT Holmes, Seth Wescott, Caroline Gleich, Steven Nyman, Marcus Caston, Ingrid Backstrom and more as they pursue turns on the mountains of our dreams—the French Alps, Alaska’s Chugach, Utah’s Wasatch, the Chilean Andes and the mightiest range of them all: the Himalaya.  Take a glimpse into the world of the U.S. freestyle team and the snowsports that live on the fringe, like monoskiing, powsurfing and speedriding. Then explore what it is about culturally rich locations and snow-covered summits that motivate passionate skiers and snowboarders to keep searching and chasing after a feeling, a memory, a storm, a turn each winter and for a lifetime more.

Om du vill komma på vår Happy Hour så registrera dig gärna på väntelistan! Om du kan delta i samtal på svenska, norska eller danska utan att prata på engelska, så är möjligheten väldigt stor att du kommer få en plats. (Vårt mål är inte prata engelska från[masked] pm)


Vänligen OSA respektfullt. Vi är en verklig grupp av vänner och våra etikettsregler återspeglar detta. Om du inser att du inte kan komma, vilket är helt ok, så se till att du uppdaterar din OSA.

We will meet this month at a conveniently located restaurant or bar in manhattan or Brooklyn.

At our meetups, conversation is mainly in the Scandinavian language of your choice, and therefore attendance is limited to those who can, at a minimum, hold down a simple conversation in Swedish, Danish or Norwegian. If you have any questions about what this means, please contact us.

Please RSVP respectfully. We are a real group of friends and our etiquette reflects that. If you realize you can't make it, that's fine, just update your RSVP.

results.description:
UPDATE: TICKETS WILL NOW BE AVAILABLE AT THE DOOR ($20, CASH ONLY)! ONLINE PAYMENTS WILL BE OPEN UNTIL APPROX. 4 PM.

Seats must be purchased through Brown Paper Tickets:  

http://filmmeetup001.brownpapertickets.com/ 

Or Paypal: 
https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MT62GC242G7CY

============================================= 

Hey movie fans, come socialize and enjoy a remarkable independent film at an exclusive private screening set up specifically for our group and others on Meetup! (Oh, and there's free popcorn....)

"Movement and Location" is a recent production from the talented team of Bodine Boling (who wrote and starred in the film) and her husband Alexis Boling (who directed).

Although sometimes referred to as a sci-fi thriller, the film has no special effects and very little sex or violence. It is ultimately about the immigrant experience and people's need for connection. (In this case, the main characters, instead of being from another country, just happen to be from hundreds of years in the future.)

After the screening, the Bolings will join us for Q & A!


FESTIVALS

Brooklyn Film Festival: Audience Award
Brooklyn Film Festival: Best Screenplay
Rome Int'l Film Festival - USA: Audience Award
Rome Int'l Film Festival - USA: Best Narrative Feature
Alhambra Theatre Film Festival: Best Actress (Bodine Boling)


REVIEWS 

“Systematically yet subtly, the Bolings and their strong cast take this certifiably oddball film in some thoughtfully intriguing places."
  – Michael Rechtshaffen, The LA Times

“Bottom Line: This low-key sci-fi feature boasts a terrific performance by Bodine Boling… Movement and Location is an intriguing, offbeat surprise.”
  – Frank Scheck, The Hollywood Reporter

“Movement and Location is an original and intelligent immigrant drama… a surprisingly resonant film about how impossible it is for most people — no matter their cosmic time zone — to carve out a life that’s emotionally honest… You don’t have to be from the future to have the past come out of nowhere to screw up the present."
   – Chuck Wilson, The Village Voice

"The drama that emerges from these broken, fugitive lives is an allegory of exile, immigration and assimilation, while defamiliarising the things (food, water, space) that we take for granted in our own times."
   – Anton Bitel, British Film Institute


SYNOPSIS

Kim Getty (B. Boling) is a "stranger in a strange land". An immigrant from 400 years in the future, she has used a time-travel service to escape her own bleak era and try to create a better life in present-day Brooklyn.

For some interesting background, here is an ad (not seen in the film) for the company, offering to send people back in time: 

https://vimeo.com/53769473

Unfortunately, the journey was strictly one-way and Kim's experience in the 21st century has been difficult. Now, after three years, she has a job, an apartment with a roommate, and is even falling in love. But when she meets a homeless teen (Missal) in the park who is also from the future, the identity Kim has managed to construct is suddenly threatened. And as her secrets are exposed, she must decide how far she is willing to go to keep the new life she has built....


Director: Alexis Boling

Starring: Bodine Boling, Catherine Missal, Brendan Griffin, David Andrew Macdonald

Length: 96 minutes

Country: USA

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ebzb20pIoks



SCHEDULE

6:00 Doors open. Claim a seat, get some refreshments, mix
          and mingle!
7:00 A brief intro to the movie.
7:10  Movie starts.
8:50 Movie ends.
9:00 Discussion/Q & A with the filmmakers.

ADMISSION

$13.50  - Before Nov 13
$20.00 - On/After Nov 13


HOW TO PURCHASE TICKETS

1) Online (2 options):  
http://filmmeetup001.brownpapertickets.com/

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MT62GC242G7CY

2) Brown Paper Tickets phone orders: 1 (800)[masked] 
Please request event #[masked] (no code necessary).

3) No funds (cash or credit) will be accepted on-site. Please purchase your seat by one of the above methods. 

4) The names of all attendees will be on a list at the door. There are no physical tickets.

5) Please note the price increase on November 13. Securing your seat as early as possible is recommended.

6) RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your seat or lock in the price. 

7) Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled).  However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place. At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.

8) Price includes free popcorn. Additional refreshments will also be available for separate purchase.


See you there!

Milton

results.description:
We will be learning and exploring the Tensegrity Practices developed by Carlos Castaneda.  The practice is mainly focused on the Magical Passes – modernized forms of body movements which open us to our energetic core, giving us vitality and physical prowess, concentration and purpose, overall wellbeing of body, mind, emotions and spirit, and enhanced awareness.  

Open to all levels.  Please wear comfortable clothing and bring water.  No street shoes are allowed in the studio.

Suggested Donation: $8.00

Contact: [masked] or[masked]

Looking forward to practice with you.  

NYC Tensegrity Group
results.how_to_find_us: Please contact us at nyintent@gmail.com or call us at 917-498-1071

UPDATE: TICKETS WILL NOW BE AVAILABLE AT THE DOOR ($20, CASH ONLY)! ONLINE PAYMENTS WILL BE OPEN UNTIL APPROX. 4 PM.

Seats must be purchased through Brown Paper Tickets: 
http://filmmeetup001.brownpapertickets.com/ 

Or Paypal: 
https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MT62GC242G7CY

============================================= 

Hey movie fans, come socialize and enjoy a remarkable independent film at an exclusive private screening set up specifically for our group and others on Meetup! (Oh, and there's free popcorn....)

Note: Although heavy drinking is unlikely at a movie night, because this is a multi-meetup event it will NOT be alcohol-free.

"Movement and Location" is a recent production from the talented team of Bodine Boling (who wrote and starred in the film) and her husband Alexis Boling (who directed). 

Although sometimes referred to as a sci-fi thriller, the film has no special effects and very little sex or violence. It is ultimately about the immigrant experience and people's need for connection. (In this case, the main characters, instead of being from another country, just happen to be from hundreds of years in the future.) 

After the screening, the Bolings will join us for Q & A!


FESTIVALS 

Brooklyn Film Festival: Audience Award 
Brooklyn Film Festival: Best Screenplay 
Rome Int'l Film Festival - USA: Audience Award 
Rome Int'l Film Festival - USA: Best Narrative Feature 
Alhambra Theatre Film Festival: Best Actress (Bodine Boling)


REVIEWS 

“Systematically yet subtly, the Bolings and their strong cast take this certifiably oddball film in some thoughtfully intriguing places." 
  – Michael Rechtshaffen, The LA Times 

“Bottom Line: This low-key sci-fi feature boasts a terrific performance by Bodine Boling… Movement and Location is an intriguing, offbeat surprise.” 
  – Frank Scheck, The Hollywood Reporter

“Movement and Location is an original and intelligent immigrant drama… a surprisingly resonant film about how impossible it is for most people — no matter their cosmic time zone — to carve out a life that’s emotionally honest… You don’t have to be from the future to have the past come out of nowhere to screw up the present." 
   – Chuck Wilson, The Village Voice

"The drama that emerges from these broken, fugitive lives is an allegory of exile, immigration and assimilation, while defamiliarising the things (food, water, space) that we take for granted in our own times." 
   – Anton Bitel, British Film Institute


SYNOPSIS 

Kim Getty (B. Boling) is a "stranger in a strange land". An immigrant from 400 years in the future, she has used a time-travel service to escape her own bleak era and try to create a better life in present-day Brooklyn.

For some interesting background, here is an ad (not seen in the film) for the company, offering to send people back in time: 

https://vimeo.com/53769473

Unfortunately, the journey was strictly one-way and Kim's experience in the 21st century has been difficult. Now, after three years, she has a job, an apartment with a roommate, and is even falling in love. But when she meets a homeless teen (Missal) in the park who is also from the future, the identity Kim has managed to construct is suddenly threatened. And as her secrets are exposed, she must decide how far she is willing to go to keep the new life she has built....


Director: Alexis Boling 

Starring: Bodine Boling, Catherine Missal, Brendan Griffin, David Andrew Macdonald

Length: 96 minutes

Country: USA

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ebzb20pIoks


SCHEDULE 

6:00 Doors open. Claim a seat, get some refreshments, mix 
          and mingle! 
7:00 A brief intro to the movie. 
7:10  Movie starts. 
8:50 Movie ends. 
9:00 Discussion/Q & A with the filmmakers. 


ADMISSION 

$13.50  - Before Nov 13 
$20.00 - On/After Nov 13


HOW TO PURCHASE TICKETS 

1) Online (2 options):  
http://filmmeetup001.brownpapertickets.com/

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MT62GC242G7CY

2) Brown Paper Tickets phone orders: 1 (800)[masked] 
Please request event #[masked] (no code necessary).

3) No funds (cash or credit) will be accepted on-site. Please purchase your seat by one of the above methods. 

4) The names of all attendees will be on a list at the door. There are no physical tickets.

5) Please note the price increase on November 13. Securing your seat as early as possible is recommended.

6) RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your seat or lock in the price. 

7) Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled).  However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place. At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.

8) Price includes free popcorn. Additional refreshments will also be available for separate purchase.


See you there! 

Milton

results.description:
Bronies NYC has grown and changed over the five years of its existence. We are going into convention season and we want to make sure the group is functioning well and we have plenty of pony-riffic meetups for all of us to enjoy! We'd like as many interested parties to join us as possible so we're making this meetup 100% free to attend.

Your organizers, Kezz, Kar, Keith, Alex and Bitgamer want to introduce themselves to our new members in addition to talking about:

• How to use Meetup.com to it's fullest 

• How to organise your own meetups

• What kind of meetups do you want to see (or organise yourself!) 

• Group rules and policies

• Your thoughts on how Bronies NYC works

• The tons of exciting things on the horizon!

So join us for some fellowship and fun as we chart out our next big adventures!

Afterwards, we'll head over to the Hollywood Diner for some dineriffic dinner.
results.how_to_find_us: Room 502
results.name: Bronies NYC Community Meeting

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drinks

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 39-52 - SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.how_to_find_us: $5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. results.description:
The Sane Energy team asked ourselves: “What alternatives to fracked gas are out there?” And how much do we really know about those options, their advantages or disadvantages? So, we decided to re-launch a monthly forum, Sane Solutions, to learn more, ask the relevant questions, and work with our community to find answers. We'll be learning along with you.

Please join us for the first in the series, this one about BIODIGESTING.

One of the toughest issues with moving NYC to a fully sustainable city is the fact that (unlike in most cities) New Yorkers cook with gas. Our stoves, at present, cannot readily be converted to electric, because the majority of our building stock is so old it cannot handle the extra amperage that would be needed. And even some of the greenest advocates confess that they prefer cooking with a flame.

Could Biodigesters offer solution? How do digesters turn food scraps and other waste into kitchen gas? Is this tool useful for brownstoners, community gardeners, and suburbanites, or can it be scaled up to service an entire city? Could this get us off fracked gas that may have radon contamination? Could this help manage one of New York's biggest problems during rainstorms and floods: combined sewer overflows? Would finding a sustainable use for food waste reduce the city's landfill and rat problems? But how does Biogas compare with methane for global warming potential? And would a shift to Biogas be an excuse to build new pipelines and prolong a dependence on fossil fuels?

We welcome a team of experts to fill us in: Kathy Puffer and Dr. Thomas Henry Culhane from Solar Cities note how common biodigesters are in India; Andrew Faust, a renown permaculturist, has installed a biodigester in his home; Janice Kelsey, Dhruva and Parijata "PJ" Dasi, plus Ekayani Chamberlin for Gita Nagari Farm explain how they set up a system for their dairy. Moderated by kitchen designer and Sane Energy Senior Advisor, Clare Donohue.
results.name: PREMIERE of Sane Solutions Series: BIODIGESTING

results.description:
Discover the Benefits of Buddhist Meditation with a Real Buddhist Monk 

Have you ever wanted to meditate but don’t know where to start? Do you have an interest in Buddhist teachings but wanted to learn from a live human being rather than Wikipedia? Buddhist monk and teacher Bhante Saddhasara is excited to be able to offer bi-monthly meditation and discussion sessions that will help you reduce your level of stress and bring you a peace of mind which is sadly lacking for most of us living in the urban jungle. 

Whether you have absolutely zero experience with meditation or Buddhism or are a seasoned pro, come and join us every Saturday at 06:00pm for a short meditation and discussion session. This Meetup is offered as a gift of the Dhamma (the Teaching of the Buddha) so please come and invite your friends. Wishing you every good blessing along your path and we hope to see you at our next get together! 

This event is free but a donation within your ability helps us take care of expenses, travel and fees and necessary in order to continue offering Bhantes teachings. 

Please bring cushions because chairs are limited. 


About Bhante Saddhasara 

Bhante Saddhasara joined the Mahamevnawa Meditation Monastery in Sri Lanka in 2005, became a novice in 2006 under Ven. Kiribatgoda Gnanananda Thero, and after two years of study and practice, attained High Ordination in 2009. After three more years of study, he had begun to develop a deep understanding of insight and tranquility techniques. In 2012 he was asked to begin and to organize a meditation center in Tampa, Florida to provide training to all those who wished to learn. The center was to be non-denominational; anyone of any religion could come and study the practices. Bhante Saddhasara also offered a Recovery Program for those suffering from addiction; an introductory mindfulness program for children; a prison program; and, throughout Florida and throughout the U.S.A, he also gave lectures and provided mindfulness and meditation teaching, as well as private counseling to adults and to youths of all ages. Bhante Saddhasara speaks fluent English and very much enjoys the back and forth of his conversations with Americans.
results.name: Join Us for Guided Meditation and Discussion with Bhante Saddhasara!

I think we'll try to get those seats again. Remember it's a long night so don't cry when the clock strikes midnight and the main event hasn't started yet. Main Card: 10PM, Prelims: 8PM, Early Prelims: 6:15PM. But don't come too late. This fight will be hugely popular. If you come late, you might not get in.   Oh and I don't remember who mentioned the ad for the fight. You are right, it is awesome. Check it out here. 

I'm currently reading Ronda Rousey's book. It is amazing!  If you want a great read, check it out: Ronda Rousey My Fight Your Fight. 


I hope you guys can make.  This will be the last time we see Ophelia for a while, and our only chance to celebrate her December birthday!

See you on the 14th!  

Dawn

O Brasil Series is presented in collaboration with Cinema Tropical, and organized by guest curator Marcela Goglio. 


One of the main features of Brazil’s impressive recent output of quality cinema is its variety—of genres, voices and styles. Government funding has allowed filmmakers an unprecedented creative freedom, which has resulted in a large share of the market for local movies.

GIRIMUNHO

After the death of her husband, 81-year-old Bastu seeks a new life in the small rural town of Minas Gerais. This ghost story of deep poetic beauty, with fascinating real-life characters playing themselves and stunning pictorial compositions, was a highlight of Venice Film Festival Orizzonti in 2011.

Dirs. Clarissa Campolina, Helvecio Marins, Jr. 2011, 90 mins. Portuguese with English subtitles.

Tickets: $12. Members of the NY Brazilian Portuguese meetup group get a 20% discount at check out. Use the code NYBrazilMeetup to receive it. Click here to purchase yours.


Enjoy the movie,

Aparecida Teixeira

(***MEN AND WOMEN ARE WELCOME***) 

Take A Risk: SEX! is an experiential event where you take a risk to share and explore an aspect of your sexuality . 

When we experience ourselves as sexual beings, open to our full flow, pulsing with life energy through our body, we become more creative and feel more deeply connected to ourselves and to others. In this dynamic, interactive evening combining individual work with group process, you will learn techniques to liberate this energy and access more pleasure in your life. These techniques will be demonstrated through individual body readings with select participants who choose to take the risk of revealing a sexual issue and are willing to work through it in a supportive environment with expert guidance. 

Dr. Kincaid uses the teachings of Integral Evolutionary Tantra and the principles of Core Energetics to open up physical blocks and places where life energy doesn’t move. In Integral Evolutionary Tantric teachings and in Core Energetics -- a powerful body-based process -- sexual energy and life force energy are one and the same. Join us with body readings, deep truth, wild goodness, radical personal transformation and, if you dare, the evolution of your own personal enlightenment.


Led by Kristina Kincaid in conjunction with

The Institute of The Integral Evolutionary Tantra

Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska and Cynthia Kagoshima

Admission: $20 

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/take-a-risk-sex-with-dr-kristina-kincaid-tickets-18716768358

When you register or attend, please make a point to tell the facilitator that you heard about this event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup.


Dr. Kristina Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.
results.how_to_find_us: Between 6th and 7th Ave, 18th floor
