results.description:
Are you craving deeper connections in your life?

Do you want to experience more awareness/presence in your day to day life ?

Do you ever have the feeling that you could be enjoying richer more authentic interactions with people?

Sometimes creating profound connection is as easy as looking just beneath the surface with whoever we are with, at any given time and simply being more present with what actually is.

Join The Connection Movement and Authentic Relating NYC at Reflections Yoga for social games that invite us beneath the surface and into a deeper experience of ourselves and others.

Authenticity Games are a fun, highly-interactive partner and group exercise that explore ways of seeing, connecting, appreciating yourself and others at a deeper level. They are a safe and structured way for us to go beyond small talk and beyond superficial appearances.

It’s an opportunity for us to have fun and celebrate with great people who are also wanting to explore what’s possible in connection.

Join us for some fun relational games, socializing, and snacks

Bring a friend, or come alone and meet some awesome new people.

When we celebrate and explore what makes each of us unique, we often end up realizing just how much we all have in common.

Games Night begins at 7 pm and will wrap up around 10 pm - we generally visit, eat, socialize, do acro-yoga, and hang out in cuddle-piles after the games wrap up. Hope you'll plan on lingering with us.

TO PAY IN ADVANCE: http://relatinggames.eventbrite.com/

Payment:
$30 at the door
$25 in advance

Reflections Yoga
227 East 24th Street
between 3rd and 2nd

(NOTE - the address for Reflections on Google Maps and Reflections' mobile site have not been updated to indicate the NEW location on East 24th Street)

Follow The Connection Movement on Facebook
www.facebook.com/theconnectmove

For updates on authentic relating events in New York, join our Meetup or Facebook groups

http://www.meetup.com/connectionmovement

https://www.facebook.com/groups/authenticrelatingnyc/
results.name: Connection Lab - Authenticity and Relating Games to Build Connection & Community

results.description:
Shawn Wyckoff and Maria Millar are Juilliard-trained musicians who formed a band called Sonic Escape in 2009. They are both *vegans*, a married couple, and they are members of our meetup group. Shawn plays flute and Maria plays violin (and also dances). They are also both extremely sweet people.

They are very successful musicians! They continually tour the United States and the world, and have played at Carnegie Hall, the Kennedy Center, Avery Fisher Hall, and Radio City Music Hall, and have appeared on ABC, CBS, the WB, and the BBC. Maria also had 170 performances as Solo Dancing Fiddler in Riverdance On Broadway.

Some YouTube videos:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0NLs-HTxfHk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7y4g1cs_KOc

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=17h91utSMxo

Shawn and Maria love our Veg Meetup group, and they wanted to somehow put on a low-priced performance with the Meetup group in mind. So they are going to be appearing at The Delancey on Saturday, Nov. 14th for us. The trio will be rounded out with cellist Nan-Cheng Chen, also a Juilliard graduate. Members of the general public will be permitted to attend as well, but this performance will mostly be focused on us. This show features the NYC debut of Tofu Kitty. It’s a new, upbeat piece by Maria Millar which recounts, through lyrics, the comedic ups & downs of pursuing an ethical life in NYC (including veganism).


The Delancey will have two or three vegan food options available for tonight for our Veg Meetup group. I will be eating dinner at The Delancey this evening, and I hope you will join me. I applaud The Delancey's "college try" of adding vegan items to their menu for one night, and who knows, if they sell a lot maybe this will inspire The Delancey to keep these new items permanently.

Tickets for this performance cost $12, purchased online in advance. (And that's it -- no additional service fees, and no drink or food minimum at the venue.) Tickets at the door will be $15 CASH ONLY. This show may sell out, so we encourage you to purchase tickets online in advance. Also, for this performance, while there is a large seating area and most people will be seated, there will also be some standing room. If you want to guarantee yourself a seat (as opposed to standing room), you should arrive when the doors open at 7:00pm. Sonic Escape's performance will start at 7:30pm. (I suggest you have some meetup members hold your seats, then get up and purchase whatever food and drink you may want to.)

Here is the link for $12 advance tickets (no service charge of any kind):

http://www.sonicescapemusic.com/show/show-and-after-party-at-the-delancey/#tickets

More Links

Sonic Escape's website: http://www.sonicescapemusic.com

Sonic Escape's bio page: http://www.sonicescapemusic.com/about/biography

Sonic Escape's video page: http://www.sonicescapemusic.com/videos/performance

The Delancey (venue) website: http://thedelancey.com

After the performance, Shawn and Maria will hang out with us. As I said, they are regular meetup members and they love coming to meetup events and hanging out with the group.

Shawn and Maria are so extremely nice, and just lovely, lovely people. And they're amazing, Juilliard-trained, world-touring musicians. And VEGANS. I happen to be a huge YouTube fan of theirs, and in my personal estimation, I rate them a 10 out of 10. Join us for this wonderful evening of exuberant, world-class entertainment and relaxing, fun times.

David
results.name: Vegan, Juilliard-Trained Music Group SONIC ESCAPE Performs @ The Delancey

results.description:
HETEP is an Egyptian word for being calm and content within the self.
Healing Touch Program gathers a community of people who want to communicate love, respect, and compassion through the language of healing touch. They care to keep improving their ‘touch intelligence’ so as to be aware of another’s needs and boundaries. 

A HETEP GATHERING starts with an invocation to the Elements and the various aspects of the Mother Goddess. The space created is sacred and safe for all of us to share our experiences - our thoughts and feelings, our presence, and the rhythms of our breathing as we participate in the expansion of our touch perception.

This event is expanding now to include everyone interested in evolving their 'touch intelligence'. It has been a monthly women's gathering and a wonderful opportunity to share and celebrate our intention, strength, and life experience!

You're invited to join this ongoing class at any time. It is 'by donation', because your healing presence is the most important material you can contribute! So please come and donate your body to the science of healing - we will return it renewed and energized. 

Every gathering starts with an introduction of ourselves in a circle. You will be introduced to this simple healing touch method. We will practice on each other on the floor lined with yoga mats and blankets. You may want to wear comfortable clothes and bring a yoga mat. This program is designed for every body shape and sensory ability - or sensitivity! 

HETEP facilitator, Karuna Ma has been introduced to healing touch very early in life. Since 1998, qualified as a Reiki Master Healer and Seichim Master Teacher. Seichim energy is sometimes called 'Egyptian Kundalini' as it is great at assisting a breakthrough experience for both physical and psychic well-being. Since her training in 2001, Karuna has been working as a massage therapist, energy and sound healer.
results.name: HETEP Healing Touch Program

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

Join us for a slightly different Saturday night out as we get to watch the Democratic presidential candidates face off for the road to the White House.  It will be a fun and interesting evening as the top candidates square off with each other.  This event is first and foremost meant to be a social gathering that is open to all members and friends.  Arrive at 7:30pm for socializing and cocktails at the bar, you can also grab a bite to eat with others in the group then sit back and catch all the action on dozens of large monitors.

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

Do I have to be a Democrat to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the Republican Debates as well

FOLLOWING THE DEBATES THE BAR WILL REMAIN OPEN TO OUR GUESTS FOR SOCIALIZING.

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  The Playwright is a casual place but you may want to keep it neat after all it is a Saturday night in NYC!

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.  If you wish to sit and eat with the group.  Please arrive at 7pm.

If you do not see a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be many people attending from other groups, YOU WILL NOT BE ALONE!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Presidential Debates Viewing Party (optional) Dinner

results.description:
Mary Wesley will call a lively program of contras accompanied by Sassafras Stomp!

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: Contra Dance with Mary Wesley and Sassafras Stomp!

results.description:
www.NYCHorrorfest.com

Immediately following programs 10 and 11

The Micheal J Hein  award for Personal Achievement  in Acting presented to TOM ATKINS!

Handsome, rugged, versatile and charismatic character actor Tom Atkins was born on November 13, 1935 in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. Atkins initially became an avid horror film fan in his childhood days; Howard Hawks‘ immortal classic The Thing from Another World (1951) made an especially strong impression on him as a kid. Tom attended Duquesne University in Pittsburgh and was a member of the Gamma Phi Fraternity. Atkins made his film debut as a rookie police officer in the Frank Sinatra private eye-outing The Detective (1968); it was the first of many police officer roles he has played throughout the years. Tom appeared in two films for director John Carpenter: he is very likable as Nick Castle in the spooky ghost film The Fog (1980) and solid as Rehme in the fantastic futuristic sci-fi/action cult film Escape from New York (1981). Atkins had a nice small role as a disapproving and overbearing father in the wrap-around segments of the immensely enjoyable fright feature anthology Creepshow (1982). He made for a touchingly flawed hero as Dr. Daniel Challis in the unjustly maligned Halloween III: Season of the Witch (1982).

Program #10 in the ELEKTRA THEATER

Shorts:

FIRST NIGHT IN THE NEW HOUSE ……….5 MINS…………..Dir. Marc Fratto

THE HUCKSTER ……………………………………..28MINS………….Dir. Alicia Albares

Feature Film:

LANDMINE GOES CLICK ……………………….104 MINS…………..Dir. Levan Bakhia


Trapped standing on an armed landmine, an American tourist is forced to watch helplessly while his girlfriend is terrorized and brutally assaulted.


PROGRAM #11 in the KILL BAR THEATER

Shorts:

TICKLE…………………..12 MINS………………..Dir. Corey Norman

HEIR………………………14MINS………………..Dir. Richard Powell

Feature Film:

LAST GIRL STANDING…………..90………….Dir. Benjamin Moody….NYC Premier

She survived a brutal massacre, but lost her life. What happens to the final girl after the credits roll?

results.description:
This fall, Warren Miller Entertainment will release its 66th snow sports film, Chasing Shadows. Watch JT Holmes, Seth Wescott, Caroline Gleich, Steven Nyman, Marcus Caston and more as they pursue turns on the mountains of our dreams: Chamonix, Alaska’s Chugach, the Chilean Andes, Utah’s Wasatch and the mightiest range of them all: the Himalaya. These athletes are masters in their element, and with every cliff drop, perfect line and neck-deep powder turn, they motivate us. Warren Miller once said, “A pair of skis are the ultimate transportation to freedom,” and this year, we’re chasing storms, snow, lines that live on the world’s highest peaks, and the freedom that these things grant us.

Explore what it means to be inspired, and what it is about exotic locations and snow-covered summits that keep us searching for more. As skiers and snowboarders we chase a feeling, a memory, a storm, a turn — we’ve been chasing it our whole lives and we’ll keep chasing it a lifetime more.

Trailer -->

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WF1D3aML-3I


All attendees will receive free lift ticket vouchers (some restrictions apply) to each of the following:
Gore Mountain
Sugarbush
Snowbird
Belleayre Mountain 

Remember to keep your paper ticket or E-ticket in order to get the free lift ticket vouchers as you enter or during the intermission. For additional information about the films, athletes, directions and to view the Warren Miller Ticket to Ride trailer go to:
http://www.chestnutmtnproductions.com/warren-miller/new-york-city/ 

Tickets:

•  Adults - $23 in advance; $26 day of the show.

• Children, Students (Advance) $18;


Tickets are still available at the following locations:

• Peter Norton Symphony Space, 2537 Broadway at 95th St., New York, NY 10025

• In person at the Box Office Window: Monday 3pm-6pm; Tues – Fri, 1:00 pm to 6:00 pm; and Sat, day of show 1:00 pm -8:30 pm.

•  By phone:[masked]; Tues.-Sun. 1 pm to 6 pm


•  Tickets online: http://www.symphonyspace.org/events


• Select REI stores. REI members who buy Chasing Shadows tickets in advance, do not pay any ticketing fees. 


7:45pm PRE-GAMING at Bar Thalia (downstairs, or around the corner)


Let's meet up at Thalia before the movie to have a drink and catch up.  Hopefully we can all sit together in the theater, but if not, we can at least all sit together at Thalia (maybe).


http://barthalia.org/about

results.description:
A friend of mine highly recommends this place.  Said that he knows the owner and he'll make sure they treat us right...lol.  The food and drinks are sure to please.  I hear there's even a lounge for salsa dancing.  Lets check it out!

REVIEWS....

A friend and I met up here after 2 years of catch up. Came on a Wednesday evening. The restaurant is on the second floor. Came in and impressed at the ambiance. Very nice. It wasn't too full so we were seated right away.

Intended to order apps, drinks, and entree. Got their coconut mojitos! Oh my! Yum! Ask for Waldo to make it! You won't regret it. If you enjoy coconut, you will be pleased with the ratio of taste and alcohol of this drink. Plus they don't jip you in any liquid. They fill your glass to the brim.

Got an order of the shrimp and garlic and grilled octopus. Again, was so pleased. They also give you bread along with their olive paste. At first I was reluctant to try it but we ended up getting seconds!

The place was nice enough to have us bring our drinks and go sit outside and enjoy the evening and drinks. Was there with my friend from 7-12! Haha.

Great place, service, and food! Will definitely come back!
results.name: Mojito Lounge & Restaurant

results.description:
BUY TICKETS

This is a mix of a Flash Mob, Dance Party, and City Tour all mixed into one incredible night.

With headphones on playing two channels of non-stop party music, we go underground as we hit several iconic NYC subway platforms, terminals and even bars. Unlike your normal subway ride, your Party Tour Guide/MC will not only teach you about the NYC subway system but will have you doing some crazy things to flash mob those unsuspecting passengers and onlookers .

It’s one night you’ll be like, “OMG, did we just do that!?!”

There are limited spots (100), so make sure to reserve your tickets early!

Check in Location: Raymi NYC (43 West 24th Street, Manhattan, New York 10010)
Check in time: 8:00pm – 9:00pm // Leave at: 9:00 pm
Party ends: ~12am @ Raymi NYC

Special Notes:
Age Restriction: 21+
Underground Party Ticket Holders Get Free Admission To Our After-Party @ Pacha.
All Tickets Are Limited!

What you need
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed for check-in. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $100. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into any staff member.

If you’ve never attended one of our Mobile Parties, check out the video below to get an idea of what you’re in for! You won’t want to miss it.
results.name: Underground Party – Subway Tour!

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music, great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the  8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson in your choice of rooms: Hustle, Latin and Ballroom. Then the DJ's take over and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you  NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you  EXPERIENCED DANCERS , there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor

(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes choice of free class 8-9p. Print this page & get $2 discount

*To enter building, Press 4 then 'CALL' on the intercom*

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music, great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the 8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson in your choice of rooms: Hustle, Latin and Ballroom. Then the DJ's take over and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you EXPERIENCED DANCERS, there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor
(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes choice of free class 8-9p. Print this page & get $2 discount

*To enter building, Press 4 then 'CALL' on the intercom*

group.name: The New York Ballroom Dance Meetup

venue.name: Bruno Walter Auditorium at NYPL for the Performing Arts

results.description:
ChamberMusicNY presents
The Curtis Stewart Ensemble: “Of Color, Time, and Love”

The Curtis Stewart Ensemble explores a space between era & style, creating dialogue between Western European, BeBop, Post Bop, Hip Hop & Contemporary Classical music. Curtis has been hailed by STRAD, Jazz Times & DownBeat magazines holding his audiences “spellbound” with his “warm clear sound…sparkling rhythmic energy”, “soulful improvisation” & “prodigious technique”. The aim of this project is to find the violin’s place not only in Classical music & Jazz, but as an instrumental “voice” in music from around the world & through time. This concert program will feature original compositions & songs exploring our conception of Time, Color, History & Love, as well as intricate arrangements of Jazz standards & music from the Classical cannon such as JS Bach, John Coltrane, Anton Webern & Outkast.

The Curtis Stewart Ensemble:
Curtis Stewart, violin
Alex Hills, keyboard
Tyler Gilmore, electronics
Blake Whyte, vocals
Richie Barshay, drums

No tickets needed.

ChamberMusicNY.org/concerts
results.name: ChamberMusicNY presents The Curtis Stewart Ensemble

DJ PETER TREWIN will be playing a Ballroom Mix from 8pm-1:00am  

DJ BRETT NOMBERG is bringing sexy back with a soulful mix plus a little funk in our WEST COAST SWING ROOM from 9pm-1am    Come enjoy the fun as we join together 3 different dance communities for one exciting evening of partner dancing

results.description:
Join 300+ professional singles at Manhattan's largest and most spectacular penthouse lounge, 230 Fifth, which is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline.  

What to expect: 

• Free Light Appetizers

• 2 for 1 Drinks (8-9pm) 

• Ice Breakers

• DJ & Dancing

• Giveaways

• 300+ singles 

1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "15" at checkout - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Nov-14-2015_at_0800PM

$20 after that online w/ RSVP, $30 at the door  

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non age/ethnic specific. All are welcome, 21+.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event.This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 300+ members attending. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Nov-14-2015_at_0800PM

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

results.description:
Saturday, November 14th, 8:30pm it's The FRIZZY DIZZY Comedy Show at The Room @ Dizzy's on 5th. The DOPEST night of comedy in Park Slope!

The monthly stand-up show features some of New York's best comedians for only $10. Dizzy's menu is new American comfort food. November Lineup: Jon Laster, Del Harrison, Drew Dowdey, Sooyah Jun, Eliana Horeczko

Purchase tickets in advance HERE
results.name: The DOPEST night of Comedy in the Slope!

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Please arrive on time. All games begin promptly at 8:15pm. This should give any late comers 15 minutes to arrive in case you get stuck and time to warm up.

(4) Games will be 30-40 minute halves. We will switch sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $3.00 for the night. Permit cost me $1200 for the season, I'm not out to make money.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

results.description:

results.description:
Fantasy writer Evie Manieri will speak and answer questions at the monthly General Meeting of the Science Fiction Association of Bergen County. Ms Manieri is the author of BLOOD'S PRIDE and FORTUNE'S BLIGHT published by Tor Books. Ms Manieri has a background in theater, medieval history and singing.

Here is a link to the author's website:
http://www.eviemanieri.com/?page_id=36

Before the meeting we show animation videos (6:15 PM) and discuss news about science fiction (6:30 PM). The S F A B C also sponsors book groups, movie nights, television gatherings, critique sessions and other events each month.

The Association's website is:
https://sites.google.com/site/sfassnofbergencounty/home

There is no charge for anyone attending a meeting of the Association for the first time. If you have previously attended and are uncertain of the fee, write to SFABCinfo (at) gmail.com.

Hope to see you there.

Phil De Parto
results.name: Meet Epic Fantasy Author Evie Manieri

results.description:
Join 300+ professional singles at Manhattan's largest and most spectacular penthouse lounge, 230 Fifth, which is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline. 

What to expect: 

• Free Light Appetizers

• 2 for 1 Drinks (8-9pm)

• Ice Breakers

• DJ & Dancing

• Giveaways

• 300+ singles 

Price: Only $20 with RSVP, or $30 at door without RSVP.

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non age/ethnic specific. All are welcome, 21+.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 300+ members attending.
results.how_to_find_us: We have reserved the Penthouse exclusively for our event.

results.description:
<a href="http://www.nadavlev.com/"></a>Come and meet like-minded singles on the yogic path.
Loving couples are most welcome too.

Saturday, Feb.14, 8:00 PM to 11:00 PM

Discussion topic: Tantric Love

Join us for a spiritual evening of lively discussion, live music, singing, meditation, sharing of vegan food and socializing at the end of the evening.
The fee is a love donation of $5 to $10, and something to eat or drink that is vegan for the group to share  We do need each person to bring something.
CALL US IF YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT TO BRING!

 

8:00 pm Introductions
8:30 pm Talk & Discussion, Songs, chants, stories, Peace meditation
9:30 pm Being in Community - sharing food, meeting friends, etc.

 

Fee for the evening is your contribution of vegan food to share and/or a suggested $10 donation.

 

RSVP by Sat, 5pm. [masked]

 

Satsang in Indian philosophy means (1) the company of the "highest truth," (2) the company of a guru, or (3) company with an assembly of persons who listen to, talk about, and assimilate the truth. This typically involves listening to or reading scriptures, reflecting on, discussing and assimilating their meaning, meditating on the source of these words, and bringing their meaning into one’s daily life. Contemporary spiritual teachers in the West frequently come from the East but can come from any part of the world.

 

The idea of satsangam was first spread by ancient Rishis such as Vedavyasa and Valmiki who explained its value in numerous ways.
results.how_to_find_us: Go to the reception desk

results.description:
Also RSVP for our Dec 4, 2015 Free Ski Ticket Party@Paragon Sports!

Nov 14, Movie Meetup: All attendees will receive a free lift ticket voucher (some restrictions apply) to Sugarbush; other mountains have also provided lift ticket vouchers in the past. 

Attendees also receive Warren Miller’s Snow World Magazine and a year’s free subscription to Ski Magazine. There will also be a raffle give away for some great prizes. 

Warren Miller once said, “A pair of skis are the ultimate transportation to freedom,” and in this year’s film, Chasing Shadows, skiers and snowboarders find that very freedom as they chase storms, snow and lines on the world’s highest peaks. Follow the world’s biggest names in skiing and snowboarding on a breathtaking cinematic journey. Watch JT Holmes, Seth Wescott, Caroline Gleich, Steven Nyman, Marcus Caston, Ingrid Backstrom and more as they pursue turns on the mountains of our dreams—the French Alps, Alaska’s Chugach, Utah’s Wasatch, the Chilean Andes and the mightiest range of them all: the Himalaya. Take a glimpse into the world of the U.S. freestyle team and the snowsports that live on the fringe, like monoskiing, powsurfing and speedriding. Then explore what it is about culturally rich locations and snow-covered summits that motivate passionate skiers and snowboarders to keep searching and chasing after a feeling, a memory, a storm, a turn each winter and for a lifetime more. 

Trailer -->

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WF1D3aML-3I

This event sells out every year so RSVP to let your friends know you are going and get your tickets early! Remember to keep your paper ticket or E-ticket in order to get the free lift ticket vouchers as you enter or during the intermission.

8pm PRE-MOVIE meetup at Bar Thalia (downstairs, with another entrance around the corner) Join Us! Have a drink, meet new ski buddies and catch up.  

http://barthalia.org/about

8:40 Get in line to get seats together at the event by 8:40.

9PM Movie starts. 

Tickets:

•  Adults - $23 in advance; $26 day of the show.

• Children, Students (Advance) $18;

Tickets are available now at: Peter Norton Symphony Space, 2537 Broadway at 95th St., New York, NY 10025

In person at the Box Office Window: Tues – Sun, 1:00pm to 6:00pm

By phone: http://www.symphonyspace.org/events

 Mail Order: Symphony Space Box Office, 2537 Broadway, NY, NY 10025 Tickets are also available at our retail partner,

 The North Face –Note: only cash or checks made payable to“T. Widing Associates”

The North Face(www.thenorthface.com) at three locations:

139 Wooster St, NYC http://www.chestnutmtnproductions.com/warren-miller/new-york-city/
results.name: Watch a Cool Ski Movie, 'Shadows'­­ by Warren Miller & Get Ski Ticket Voucher(s)

results.description:
GLIMPSES OF NITHYANANDOHAM

SAVE THE DATE: November 14th @ 8:30 pm EST

Paramahamsa Nithyananda will be conducting a live meditation to give you a glimpse of awakening your bio-energy on Nov 14th 8:30 pm EST as part of the regular satsang! 

Global meditation on bio-energy using silence during theGlimpses of Nithyanandoham program from past weekend allowed thousands of people to experience something profound they’ve never felt before. 

So by popular demand, Swamiji will be holding a special meditation to help you actually experience what it’s like to awaken your bio-energy, which is the deepest layer in you after bio-memory and muscle-memory.

WHEN:

November 14, 2015

8:30 pm - 9:30 pm EST

6 Northeast Two-Way Video Conferencing Locations:

results.description:
UPDATE: To coincide with the Community Meeting and weekly episode meeting, we will see the movie at 9:25 PM. I strongly recommend reserving your seat online as seating is more limited (as it has recliners). Focus on rows with "E" so we can sit together UPDATE 2: I added a chart from the AMC site. Row E is 5 rows from the top if you're on Fandango ordering tickets. (I'm sitting in E7 BTW)

Sorry for the wait. I've been busy with juggling work and writing a novel during NaNoWriMo.

So to get that out of the way. We are going to spend Saturday Night watching the latest animated feature from Blue Sky Animation (the creators of "Ice Age" and "Rio") "The Penauts Movie". It is currently an 86% CERTIFIED FRESH rated from rotten Tomatoes.

The meetup will be at AMC 84th Street 6, located on the Upper East Side, accessible via Subway on the 1 line (86th st. stop). This theater has reserved seating and RECLINING seats!
results.name: Bronies NYC Night at the Movies: The Peanuts Movie

results.description:
Join 300+ professional singles at Manhattan's largest and most spectacular penthouse lounge, 230 Fifth, which is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline. 


What to expect: 

• Free Light Appetizers

• 2 for 1 Drinks (8-9pm)

• Ice Breakers

• DJ & Dancing

• Giveaways

• 300+ singles 

1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "15" at checkout - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Nov-14-2015_at_0800PM

$20 after that online w/ RSVP, $30 at the door  

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non age/ethnic specific. All are welcome, 21+.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 300+ members attending. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bash/dates/Nov-14-2015_at_0800PM
results.how_to_find_us: Party is private for Meetup members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided at the door
results.name: Upscale Singles Penthouse Party (Apps, 2-1 Drinks, Icebreakers) SOLD OUT 4 MEN!

results.description:
Join the Swiss Ski Club at Warren Miller's newest 2015 film, Chasing Shadows at Symphony Space, 95th and Broadway, on Saturday, November 14th, 2015 for the 9:00pm show.

Purchase your tickets here for the Group Discount rate of $18. We will give you your ticket(s) on the evening of the show at Symphony Space. Limited number of ticket so maximum 2 tickets per person.
Buy your ticket for the movie and/or email Noreen [masked] if you will join us for dinner at 6:30.

Kouzan Japanese Restaurant,
685 Amsterdam Avenue (93rd & 94th),
New York 10025
http://www.kouzanjapanese.com

> All attendees will receive free lift ticket vouchers (some restrictions apply) to Sugarbush. Attendees also receive Warren Miller’s Snow World Magazine and a year’s free subscription to Ski Magazine. There will also be a raffle give away for some great prizes

> Follow the world’s biggest names in skiing and snowboarding on a breathtaking cinematic journey. Watch JT Holmes, Seth Wescott, Caroline Gleich, Steven Nyman, Marcus Caston, Ingrid Backstrom and more as they pursue turns on the mountains of our dreams—the French Alps, Alaska’s Chugach, Utah’s Wasatch, the Chilean Andes and the mightiest range of them all: the Himalaya.
>
> Take a glimpse into the world of the U.S. freestyle team and the snowsports that live on the fringe, like monoskiing, powsurfing and speedriding. Then explore what it is about culturally rich locations and snow-covered summits that motivate passionate skiers and snowboarders to keep searching and chasing after a feeling, a memory, a storm, a turn each winter and for a lifetime more.
results.name: Warren Miller’s 2015 Chasing Shadows

group.name: Swiss Ski Club of New York

results.description:
Watch the debates with us!

Theater in Asylum, with the NYC chapter of the Democratic Socialists of America, is preparing to create theatrical adaptations of the Democratic Primary Debates. With a small army of actors, designers, dramaturgs, and support staff, we will watch and analyze the debates, devise a piece, and present it live in NYC. There might be multiple Hillarys, a female Bernie, a Greek chorus of "questions from Facebook"--anything to illustrate and illuminate the candidates. First theater performance is in January, but join us for the first step in making it: a Watch Party!

Debate starts at 9pm, but be sure to get there early. And tip your bartender!


Learn more about the theater project: 

http://www.theaterinasylum.com/debates.html
results.name: Second Democratic Primary Debate Watch Party!

results.description:
You've spent all week busting your hump! Now it's time to unwind, loosen up the tie, say inappropriate things, and most importantly laugh til it hurts! 

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Hangout, Meet and Greet in the backroom at 9:30
Show starts at 10

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and celebrate the weekends with some laughs!

results.description:
BUY TICKETS

Get ready because we’re making our next move out to Pacha, where we’ll be holding a special quiet clubbing night, on their 3rd Floor (Pachita), to make things even more interesting. For those that don’t already know, Pacha is one of NYC’s biggest mega clubs, specializing in multiple levels of electronic dance music. Our party here last month was a wild one, so this will certainly be one to remember!

Green DJ– EDM/Dance/House
Red DJ– 90s/2K/Top40
Blue DJ– Hip Hop/R&B/Reggae

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: Quiet Clubbing @ Pacha!

group.name: !Quiet Events - Silent Disco - Quiet Clubbing and more Group

results.name: DIWALI IN THE CITY Featuring Dj Harsh with World Famous RAVI BINDRA @ LEXICON

Friends,

Join us on November 14 for our Saturday Night Social Mixer @ Slate NYC. Our members always have a fun time at that venue.

We will meet at the bottom section of the venue from 10:15pm. Please note that at some point of the night we will make our way upstairs.

Get to meet many members from the group, as well as members from my other groups.

We will be situated at the right side of the bottom bar.

Admission is free for this event. Just mention Rory's List to the door person.

There will be mingling , drinking , dancing, and more that evening.

You are always welcome to invite your family, friends classmates and colleagues.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Dress code is business casual.

We look forward in having a fun evening.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Rory

results.description:
A year after the monstrous success of 1996's neo-slasher flick Scream, director Wes Craven and screenwriter Kevin Williamson reunited for this follow-up. Since viewers last saw the characters, nosy newswoman Gale Weathers has written a sleazy best-selling book based on the events of the first film, a book that has been adapted into a Hollywood film called Stab, starring Tori Spelling as Sydney Prescott. The real Sydney (Neve Campbell) has since gone away to college in Cincinnati in hopes of leaving the horrific events of her past behind her. Unfortunately, at a showing of Stab, two college students are murdered in a fashion that is reminiscent of the slayings that took place back in Woodsboro. Suddenly, Sydney, her pal Randy (Jamie Kennedy), and dopy deputy Dewey (David Arquette) find themselves once again pursued by a ruthless masked killer. Among the other potential killers and victims are Sarah Michelle Gellar, Laurie Metcalf, and Liev Schreiber.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t-KSPVGLia4

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Major Stok’em 7 Presented by Muirskate

REGISTER HERE: http://bit.ly/1QV81PO

Date & Time:

!!DATE CHANGE!!

Sunday November 15th, 8am - 5pm


Location & Transportation:

Ross Dock area of the Palisades Interstate Park, in Fort Lee, New Jersey

http://www.njpalisades.org/picnic.htm#Ross

Walking/Skating directions from Manhattan:

http://bit.ly/1KdF5Op

Cars will ONLY be allowed down the hill BEFORE 9:00am, between 11-11:30am & 3-3:30pm and AFTER 5pm ONLY.

Event Description:

The Major Stok’em Race Series is one of the longest running and best attended downhill races in the New York City & New Jersey Areas.  Major Stokem has been a starting point for many of today’s top downhill riders.  Many claim that Major Stok’em was in fact “My very first downhill race”.  The hill is fun and exciting for beginners and experienced riders alike.  Top speed on the hills is between 29 - 39 mph depending on the wind.

There are only 80 racing spots so please be sure to preregister.  Participants will get the chance to skate the hill from 9:30am - 3pm, with the semis and finals taking place between 3pm-5pm.  You must arrive at the event BY 9AM to race in the competition!!!

Requirements:

• You must be 18 or older with a valid photo ID, or come with your parent or legal guardian to sign your release waiver.

• You must wear a helmet at all times while skating, preferably a full face helmet.  A full set of safety pads or leathers are recommended.

Registration & Costs:

REGISTER HERE: http://bit.ly/1QV81PO

Registration Period: Monday 9/21 Thru Friday 10/16 @ 5pm

Cost Per Rider: $45

Luge ONLY: $40 (you Do Not need to buy this if you are buying a skating registration ticket)

Day of Registration: $50 at event

Event Schedule:

You must arrive at the event BY 9AM to race in the competition!!

8am - 9am - Rider Check in and Final Registration

9:30am - Riders Meeting & Road Closed

9:30am - 11am - Practice Runs

11:30am - 3pm - Qualifying Rounds

3:00pm - 5pm - Semifinals & Finals

5pm - Closing Ceremony

Racing Format:

Race Classes:

Open (any skaters pro or am)

Junior (13 and under)

Luge

Rounds and Qualifying:

Practice runs from 9:30am - 11am

All Riders compete in 4 rounds of qualifying heats.

Everyone takes 4 x 4 person heats and gain points from their ranking in the heat.  Points from the 4 rounds are combined to find the top 16 scoring riders

If there is a tie for the last place in the ranking, tie breaking heats are held for those riders

Quarterfinals takes the riders from top 16 to top 8

Semi-Finals takes the riders top 8 to top 4

Finals places ranks the top 4 riders

Prizes:

Many great skate products will be up for grabs for the top 3 riders in each class. Stok’em is also known for its interesting and unique trophies.  Work hard and you may go home with one!

Raffle For STOKED:

There will be a raffle of sweet skate products to raise money for the Non-Profit Youth Group STOKED.  Tickets will be 1 for $5 or 5 for $20, and there will be tons of great skate prizes.  Please help us support this terrific action sports youth charity.  Www.Stoked.Org

Sponsors:

We would like to gratefully acknowledge all of our amazing sponsors from across the country who have helped make this event possible.

Muirskate - Title Sponsor

Uncle Funkys

G-Form

Stim Trucks

Loaded

Orangatang

NUN

Landyatchz

Original

Wild Monkey Racing

Bern

Bustin Boards

Community Shop

Hogwash

Artwork:

Please allow for the formal introduction of "The Union Genera!" poster art for Major Stok'em 7 designed by Gino Dibianco...  This race has always received tremendous support from Shralpers Union - and this year is no different, as noticed by the logo dressing the hat of the "Union General!" who kinda looks like a pirate too, so "Yarrrr"!!!  Please visit www.ginode.com to view more works by Gino Di Bianco


Hosts:


Ghostskate and Shralpers Union are excited to host Major Stok’em 7.

We would like to thank all of the skaters and sponsors who have made this event a great part of our local skating tradition.  Keep up the stoke!
results.name: Major Stok’em 7 Presented by Muirskate

results.description:
Join us for our Zoanee® Fitness Fall 2015 Instructor Training! No experience needed :)


Register here or visit www.zoanee.com/training

$290 Regular Price


$225 with coupon code: MEETUP2015


I'm looking for fresh, positive spirits to spread the Zoanee® love! You don't need to be a trained dancer or instructor. I will break down all the basic steps for you and teach you how to become a successful instructor.


What is Zoanee® Fitness?


Zoanee® Fitness is an all-level dance fitness class that uses modern belly dance moves with pop music + a hint of middle-eastern pop! It's fun, energetic and it's easy to follow!


Who can attend the training?


Anyone who is interested in the Zoanee® Fitness program can attend the training! Take this course to grow your fitness career, begin your teaching career, enhance your dance skills, or simply to expand your knowledge! 


What does it mean to become a Zoanee® Fitness instructor?


Becoming a Zoanee® Fitness instructor means being able to teach the Zoanee® program at gyms, studios, corporate offices, etc. and join a community of instructors who share the same love for Zoanee®!


How long is the training?


The training is from 9am-5pm. There is a lunch break and incremental breaks throughout the day.


Until when is the license valid?


The Zoanee® Fitness license is valid for up to one (1) year from the day of training, or as long as the instructor is a ZOPRO member in good standing. 


What is ZOPRO?


ZOPRO or Zoanee Pro is the instructor exclusive 20/mo. membership. ZOPRO's are licensed to teach as long as they are members in good standing. ZOPRO gives instructors an extensive license with rights to use the Zoanee logos, marketing materials, choreographies and tools to become successful instructors.
results.how_to_find_us: 4th Floor - Room 401
results.name: Become a Zoanee Instructor!

group.name: Zoanee Fitness: NY Bellydance Workout Group

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).

We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a couple of minutes to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

results.description:
Did you forget to sing? Perhaps after Third Grade, when the peer pressure set in. Perhaps someone picked out the "Gifted and Talented" - and it wasn't you. Or maybe the Nuns made you sing "God Bless America" and someone laughed. Or you were one of the "Blue Birds" - you moved your mouth but didn't make any sound. Or did you sing beautifully in that Elementary School play? Was it the Middle School chorus, where the boys were thrown out and it ended up a Girls Club that made a sound in three parts, so beautiful nothing to this day has extinguished that feeling? Perhaps you were one of the guys who made harmony in the reverb of the Boys Room, or in the audience at the concert, or the sports stadium, or in the shower?

Or maybe you played an instrument that kept your mouth busy, and you never did get the chance to sing? Was it the race of competition for excellence in something, something else, that left you no time?

Was is the implicit warning, between the lines of the praises of privilege, that you should not express yourself? Did you forget that feeling of camaraderie and being a part of something bigger than yourself? Did you forget that amazement you felt at yourself being able to memorize a large piece and give it your all - weeks and months of practice that lead to a performance, or several, that made you feel powerful, hopeful, inspired and you had drawn upon that experience to guide your life? You had that moment, lifted by the magic of the "ordered progression though time and space," that made life so rich, so romantic, so filled with spirit.

And then did you forget?

Forget that feeling, that high, that experience of joy and sadness, playing the part, being a messenger, a vessel. You forgot that there are scientific studies praising the participation in music and art, the health benefits, the raised white blood cell count, the relaxation response, the breathing, the healing power of sound, or just the old saying, "singing is good for you."

Now you have another chance.

Don't miss it.
results.name: Did You Forget to Sing?

results.description:

This ancient healing tradition offers balance, relaxation and healing at the cellular level. The hand-hammered bowls are from Nepal and are made of a special seven-metal alloy. Protocols for deep relaxation, healing and balance will be offered. There is a $40 fee for this workshop, please register in advance to reserve your seat.

Participants are asked to bring a blanket or yoga mat to lie on, a cushion for the head, and a blanket for the body. Comfort is important. For those with lower back pain, bring an extra cushion for under the knees.

Time: 5-6    Physical Level: Easy

Length: 6-7 miles  Route Type: Loop Hike

We will  explore the highest portion of the park, walk along Appalachian trail, hike  through  Lemon squeezer, visit two shelters used by overnight hikers, walk along lake, see some wildlife if we have some luck.

Harriman State Park, located in Rockland and Orange counties, is the second-largest park in the parks system, with 31 lakes and reservoirs, 200 miles of hiking trails, two beaches, two public camping areas, a network of group camps, miles of streams and scenic roads, and scores of wildlife species, vistas and vantage points. Harriman State Park's major facilities include Lakes Welch, Sebago, Tiorati and Silvermine, the Anthony Wayne Recreation Area, Sebago Cabins and Beaver Pond Campgrounds.

There is NO charge for the hike.

What to bring for the hike: 2 liters or more water, packed lunch (sandwich, snacks, fruits), layers of clothing good for 50F, light backpack. Preferably wear hiking boots. 

Meeting time: 10am 

Location: Lake Skannatati Parking Lot at Seven Lakes Drive

Google Maps Link: https://goo.gl/maps/x3iq5HzKM912

results.description:
A 2 hour timed, out and back run on the Palisades Park Long Path.

Trail Details: We'll run over the GW bridge, to the Palisades long path. We run for 1 hour, turn around and run back. How far is that? Depends on your pace and skill level. This run should take about 2 hours total. Perhaps a bit longer, if you are tired on the way back. Perhaps a bit less, if you conserve your energy on the way out. This is a mild trail, great for beginners. Keep in mind though, it does tend to get more technical the farther north you go. As always, we encourage all speeds to join, no matter how fast or slow. Can't run for two hours? No worries, simply turn around sooner.

Public Transit: Take the A train to 175th Street. The the south entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk is near the corner of West 178th Street and Cabrini Boulevard. (Meet at the north entrance, if the south is closed.) If you live in Jersey, meet us at the trail head on the Jersey side at 10:15-ish.

Bag Drop/Etc: Afterwards, we head to Le Chéile for drinks and food. Le Chéile is Located on the corner of W 181st Street and Cabrini Blvd 2 blocks from the south entrance of the GW bridge sidewalk. As far as dropping a bag before the run goes, there is always a bush or a pile of leaves to stash your stuff in, just make sure everything important is on you while you run. Sometimes Brooklyn Trail Runners who own cars show up to this location.

results.description:
Come Join us for a 35 mile Bike Ride starting on the Hudson Valley Rail Trail, crossing over the Walkway over the Hudson and continuing across the river on the Dutchess County Rail Trail. Please CLICK the links throughout this description for maps and/or website information.

The entire ride is paved and open to all levels.  A Road Bike or Hybrid is recommended but a Mountain Bike can be used if you don't mind going slower.  The group may naturally break up depending on varying skill levels. Since this ride is an out and back trip you can turn around at any point if you feel exhausted.


We will meet at 10:00am at the Tony Williams Town Park off S. Riverside Dr. in Highland, NY.

Have all your gear ready and plan to start promptly by 10:15am.



MANDATORY GEAR:

• Road Bike, Hybrid or Mountain Bike

• Bicycle Helmet

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Clear eye Protection (safety glasses - for bugs, dirt, etc.)

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, etc.

• Bike Pump

• Tire Patch Kit and/or Spare Tube

PLEASE INSPECT YOUR BIKE PRIOR TO ARRIVAL TO INSURE THE FOLLOWING:

• Proper Tire Inflation

• Lubricated chain

• Properly Shifting gears

• Functional Brakes that don't rub rim or tire when released.


AFTER THE RIDE WE WILL BE HEADING OVER TO THE ANGRY APPLE ORCHARD CIDER HOUSE IN WALDEN, NY!

We’re excited to welcome visitors to our Orchard and Innovation Cider House in Walden, NY during the month of November on our select opening weekends! You’ll be able to come by and take the self-guided tour to learn a bit about the history of cider and the cider-making process, see what our cider makers are pressing and fermenting, and taste some specialty Angry Orchard ciders made on-site!

Sunday, November 15th, 2015, 11am – 5pm ET

We are located at:

2241 Albany Post Road

Walden, NY 12586

Phone number:[masked]

http://www.angryorchard.com/

There is no admission fee to visit the Angry Orchard and no reservations are required. Stop on by!

results.description:
Hello F1 Fans,

   The penultimate race of the 2015 Formula One season takes teams & drivers to the lone race in South America for the Brazilian Grand Prix held at the histioric Autódromo José Carlos Pace in the Interlagos district of Sao Paulo.

THE TRACK - At 4.31 km in length Interlagos is the 2nd shortest track on the calendar after Monaco. The 15 corner track runs anti-clockwise includes a tough combination of technically demanding medium & slow-speed turns linked by high-speed straights and corners. The track features a brand new pit complex for this season.

TYRE ALLOCATION -  The P Zero White medium and P Zero Yellow soft compound have been nominated for this year's Brazilian Grand Prix by Pirelli. Expected performance gap between the two compounds is 0.9 seconds per lap.

TALKING POINTS - Can Rosberg hold-off Hamilton for another win in Brazil? Can Ferrari bounce back from a double DNF and win the race in Sao Paulo? Will Red Bull spring a surprise with the upgraded Renault engine? 

If you're in the New York City area and looking for some great racing action with other F1 fans, be sure to join us for the Brazilian Grand Prix to see who will take the checkered flag. Race will start at 11:00am EST with the pre-race starting at 10:30am. In anticipation of a large gathering, Feile will be accepting reservations. Please contact Feile at [masked].

We hope to see you all!

results.description:
Using The Human Rights framework, the presenters Cora Miles and Sandra Bernabei will interact with participants to examine, define, and identify systemic, structural Racism which has become deeply embedded in every single system we use at every age and stage of our lives from birth to death.  

In accord with The Human Rights model, the Westchester AntiRacist Alliance will encourage workshop participants to think about, and to actively use their individual sphere(s) of influence to Undo Racism.     

Cora Miles, Educator, has devoted her career to teaching and learning with children,  families, and classroom teachers for over 30 years in the New York City Board of Education.  Following retirement as an Assistant Principal, Cora continued her journey as a teacher trainer in schools in NYC and Yonkers through Bank Street College of Education collaboration; facilitated Social and Emotional Learning workshops designed for teachers, students, parents and school administrators given at learning sites in the NYC area.

Sandra Bernabei, MSW, is a community organizer and a social worker in private practice in Westchester and NYC. She is the current President of the National Association of Social Workers-New York City Chapter.Sandy is a founding member of the Antiracist Alliance, an antiracist organizing collective of New York City area human service practitioners. ARA is building a movement to to bring an analysis of structural racism as outlined by the People's Institute for Survival and Beyond to social work education and practice.  Over 10,000 educators and Human services practitioners have participated in the undoing racism/community organizing workshops to date. 

In 2012 Sandra received Social Worker of the Year Award from NASW Westchester Division; the NASW NYC Social Work Image Award in May 2008; and In January 2008 a recognition award at the 10th anniversary of the Rockland County Drug Court for her work as founder of a grassroots community effort that established the drug court. She is a board member for The Center for the Study of White American Culture, and served on the Board of WESPAC Foundation here in Westchester. 

Regular Ethical Education for Children classes today.
results.name: "The Work of Undoing Racism is the Work of Human Rights"

results.description:
It’s a concept as old as business itself—you’re only as strong as your professional network. The quality of the bonds you build with individuals is one of the most important steps you can take toward landing your dream job or dream client. Yet as with any other pivotal sales and marketing activity, effective networking takes time, practice and sometimes a little outside help. 

At this event, we’ll teach you how to make long-lasting connections both on and offline, as well as how to ask the right questions that will help you grow your professional relationships quickly, effectively and painlessly.

It’s a learn-by-doing workshop from which you’ll walk away with a new set of networking skills combining the best parts of human interactivity with technology and common sense.

This invaluable seminar includes...

Business Cards: The Next Generation—This exercise will lead you through the process of creating a new kind of business card that will transform how you nurture new relationships.

The Art of Web Spinning—An interactive exercise that will show you how you can be most helpful to the people you are meeting for quick and abundant returns.

Connective Collaboration – A hands-on demonstration of working with others to create online content that is profitable in more ways that one. 

The Art of The Ask - Learn how to ask the right people, the right questions, at the right time.

And be sure to join us afterwards at Lillie's Union Square to put into practice what you learned during the seminar: http://unionsquare.lilliesnyc.com/

PANELISTS

Blaine Graboyes - Blaine is an award-winning Executive Producer and successful startup entrepreneur with nearly twenty years’ experience developing digital entertainment.  He is a founding partner in The Gamer Agency based in NYC, the only media, production, and talent agency solely focused on video games. Blaine is also an active member of the Producers Guild Of America (PGA), and is co-chair of the Guild’s highly successful Produced By: New York conference.

Michael Roderick - Michael began his career in education and entertainment working first as a High School English teacher. His next venture was producing Off Broadway and then on Broadway, which led to Michael starting an arts incubator program to teach artists about building their own businesses. Most recently, Michael founded The Connecting Connectors Conference (ConnectorCon) and runs his consulting company Small Pond Enterprises LLC, focusing on helping businesses grow by leveraging their networks.

Michael Schein - Michael is the CEO of MicroFame Media, a digital content marketing and strategy agency that implements systems and processes for turning organizations into recognized authorities in their fields for the purpose of generating new business. Schein also created, ran, and moderated the New York Technology Council’s (NYTech) Interactive Marketing panel series.

Jen Begeal - Jen is the Host and Co-Founder of StoryForward NYC. She is a digital content strategist specializing in producing cross-platform marketing campaigns for entertainment properties and technology start-ups.  Jen is also an adjunct professor in the New Media department at Concordia College in Bronxville, New York where she teaches classes on multi-media design and business networking.
results.name: The Art of Networking and Relationship Building

results.description:
~15, ~20, 31-mile options.
(or modify on your own for a shorter distance.)

Start at Bear Mt Inn. Run/ hike practice on The North Face Endurance Challenge NY 50k course! At Bear Mountain State Park. Exploratory adventure trek: Work together to use maps to route-find.  

DETAILS

Meet: In front of inn, (845)[masked] . Restrooms and water fountains inside by gift shop.


Transport: 

At this meeting time, the only way to get there is for you to drive. Cars: $8 /vehicle. If people want to drive to and volunteer as drivers, please say so in comments section below. Carpool to split the cost of car admission and gas. 

How:  Social. Partner / form pace groups as needed. (Co-host Rosanna will run/walk as sweeper for beginning part of run (combo: run slowly and fast hike). Feel free to break away and run at your own pace -- just make sure you have your supplies, and map as a guide! 


Rain or shine. Heavy rain cancels! Check comments section for updates.

Who:  Trail runners and hikers. All paces are welcome!  Guests, friends and family are welcome. Each person is expected to be prepared, self-sufficient, able to find her way back to start, and able to help each other if necessary. Thanks.

Groups:  I strongly suggest partnering at the start of run, and that each group/partner wait for each other at intersections, leaving no one behind for wilderness safety. This would be a good opportunity to work as a team with other local hikers/runners at your level, test map-reading skills, and to discover trails without having to do it on your own.

REQUIREMENTS

BRING AND REVIEW IN ADVANCE:

1) Download/print and carry:  
a)  "Harriman Bear Mountain" trails map (map #119) **

b)  The North Face Endurance Challenge 50k course map and turn sheet  (p. 3, 5-6)
* Review course map, turn sheet and take note of your selected route, esp. for shorter options:
 ~15 miles (eastern loop that stays in BM SP, with Anthony Wayne rec area mid-point), ~20 miles (~15 mile loop + small loop: Anthony Wayne (W)--Seven Lakes Rd--Silvermine Rd--Red--1779--Anthony Wayne), or ~31 miles (entire course of both loops).

2)  Backpack with all the water and fuel you need!

3)  Headlamp (as a precaution, if you plan to be most of day)  


**  You can buy the HBM paper map at the gift shop. If closed, go to parks police station across the field. It's also available at REI. 



Facilities:  Restrooms and limited water on way: water fountains at start (and off-route at Anthony Wayne Rec area). We were advised to bring and carry all our own water and supplies.

Sunset:  Time

Weather:  Bear Mountain, NY

Comments? Want to form a carpool? Post in comments section below.

Happy trails!


_____________________________________________________


Note

This is not an organized training program. It is just a notice of activities some members are planning to do that is sent out to those who might want to join them. By choosing to join them, you agree that you are an adult over 21 and agree to the legal disclaimer. Each person is solely responsible for himself, and for following trail etiquette<a href="http://www.trailrunner.com/news/trail_etiquette.htm"></a>, laws, park rules, and park safety guidelines. Thanks!!!

Jone Johnson Lewis is the Interim Clergy Leader of the Brooklyn Society for Ethical Culture. She's been an Ethical Culture Leader since 1991, and before that, worked in training and education in the private sector. She's with us half-time, and serves as Leader of the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture half-time as well.
