results.description:
We will be reading Missing Microbes:  How the Overuse of Antibiotics Is Fueling Our Modern Plagues by Martin J. Blaser, MD


A critically important and startling look at the harmful effects of overusing antibiotics, from the field's leading expert

Tracing one scientist’s journey toward understanding the crucial importance of the microbiome, this revolutionary book will take readers to the forefront of trail-blazing research while revealing the damage that overuse of antibiotics is doing to our health: contributing to the rise of obesity, asthma, diabetes, and certain forms of cancer. In Missing Microbes, Dr. Martin Blaser invites us into the wilds of the human microbiome where for hundreds of thousands of years bacterial and human cells have existed in a peaceful symbiosis that is responsible for the health and equilibrium of our body. Now, this invisible eden is being irrevocably damaged by some of our most revered medical advances—antibiotics—threatening the extinction of our irreplaceable microbes with terrible health consequences. Taking us into both the lab and deep into the fields where these troubling effects can be witnessed firsthand, Blaser not only provides cutting edge evidence for the adverse effects of antibiotics, he tells us what we can do to avoid even more catastrophic health problems in the future.

NY Times Review:

http://www.nytimes.com/2014/04/29/health/missing-microbes-how-antibiotics-can-do-harm.html

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Are you looking to BALANCE your training & stretching?

Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

Looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track?

Would you like to RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by combining it with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL balance your whole being in training!

Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements (overuse) on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten in ingrained patterns around muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga class, one can better release tension, move with ease, and benefit from improved posture and injury prevention.  In addition, increased respiratory control and focus have been reported by students.

The Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with series of held Yin floor postures to open the meridian/chakras pathways of the body. While surrendering into the edge of each pose for 2-5 minutes, students are guided in the cultivation of observance and breath, as they experience release of connective tissues and the stagnant energy around the hips, thighs, and lower back. Awareness is emphasized to sensations in the body that are grounding and powerful experience of the NOW. The Yang or moving practice allows students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for circulation, and flexibility, into vigorous strengthening postures and movement sequences. Freedom of breath, alignment, and mental clarity will be elicited deeply during, after the class, and into one's training.

After our INTRO CLASS ON 9/10: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

AND another student reported achieving best time running a 18 mile course...


**10 Classes Only - Join weekly for maximum benefits and donate suggested $15 per class for this this performance enhancing class not offered anywhere else in NYC!


Please message me other days/times for Spring Program Offering considerations.  Thank you!


Namaste, Jennifer, RYT-500hr

We'll meet-up on Sunday November 15th @ 11:30am for brunch before Ms. Renea's performance of “I Got My life". Part two incorporates love songs that chronologically follow several of her most complex relationships. The tribute set rounds out with Nina Simone's gospel-infused acknowledgement and celebration of blackness.

The cost of this special Sunday gathering is $15.00 when you RSVP "Yes" today, while supplies last. There is a $10.00 food/beverage minimum at the table.

results.description:
Let's explore the forests and wetlands of Bronx's Pelham Bay Park, the City's largest, where I've seen turkeys, deer, and numerous large water birds. We'll stop for lunch in the lovely gardens of historic Bartow-Pell Mansion, then walk to picturesque City Island. We'll end the day with an optional dinner at a delicious fresh-seafood restaurant, where two people can comfortably share a huge entree costing about $11 apiece (excluding tax and tip).

DISTANCE: About 6 miles.

PACE: MODERATE (2 mph), not slow. If you want to stroll rather than walk moderately, this is not the hike for you.

ENDING TIME: You'll get back to the subway station (by bus from City Island) at around 5:30-6:00 PM if you skip dinner, 7:30-8 PM if you don't. You can leave earlier as well, by catching the bus to the subway around 3:30 to 4:00 PM.


INSTRUCTIONS: Bring lunch. And while the risk of ticks is much lower at this time of year, take precautions: Wear long, light-colored clothing if possible (no short pants or sleeves), and bring insect repellent (at least 20% deet) if you can; I'll bring some if you can't. Also, wear boots if possible, since some of the trails are a bit uneven.

COST: $2 (in part to cover meetup's organizer fee), plus the price of dinner.

WAITING LIST: Be patient. Last week a list of 70 people disappeared entirely by the morning of the walk due to cancellations, especially at the last minute.


DRIVERS: Option 1: Park in the Middletown Rd. parking lot (see directions below). Walk out of the same entrance, turn right, then right again onto Middletown Rd, heading toward the Expressway. Turn right a third time onto the path running parallel to the expressway, and walk north (along the edge of the park). After passing two pedestrian bridges (one at Middletown Rd.) and one motor-vehicle bridge, you'll find us at the bottom of the third pedestrian bridge, across the expressway from the elevated subway station. (If you happen to get lost on foot, ask someone how to find the bridge to the subway.) It's roughly a 15-minute walk--but unlike street parking near the subway, it's guaranteed.

Option 2: The elevated train station and pedestrian bridge are located near the intersection of Westchester Ave. and Amendola Place; if you get near there and can't find it, ask anyone in the neighborhood; they should know. Try parking on the street nearby, then climb the stairs to the subway station (no fare required) and walk across the bridge. Leave extra time for this option; drivers have reported that parking isn't difficult, but of course there's no guarantee.

DRIVING DIRECTIONS TO PARKING LOT (OPTION 1, ABOVE). FOR OPTION 2, USE YOUR GPS TO WESTCHESTER AVENUE AND AMENDOLA PLACE.

From the New England Thruway (I-95) South
Take I-95 South to the Westchester Avenue exit.  Go straight along the service road for approximately 4 lights and make a left onto Jarvis Place to go over the I-95/Bruckner Expressway.  Make the next left and head north on the service road.  At the first light, make a right onto Middletown Road.  At the end of the street (Stadium Ave), make a left into the park and the first left into the parking lot. Then walk to the meeting spot, as described in option 1, above.

From the Bruckner Expressway
Take the Bruckner Expressway north and exit at the Lafayette Avenue exit.  Stay on the northbound service road and make a right onto Middletown Road.  At the end of the block (Stadium Ave), make a left into the park and another left turn into the parking lot. Then walk to the meeting spot, as described in option 1, above.

From the I-95 North
Take I-95 north and exit at the Country Club Road/Pelham Bay Park exit.  Stay on the northbound service road and make a right onto Middletown Road.  At the end of the block (Stadium Ave), make a left into the park and another left turn into the parking lot. Then walk to the meeting spot, as described in option 1, above.

From Pelham Parkway, eastbound
Take Pelham Parkway eastbound past Eastchester Road and get into the right lane.  Go through the next light and make a right turn onto the Pelham Parkway service road. (Be careful not to get onto the Hutchinson River Parkway.)  Follow the service road around to a stop sign and under the IRT No. 6 train and head south along the Bruckner Expressway service road.  Go straight along the service road for approximately 4 lights and make a left onto Jarvis Place to go over the I-95/Bruckner Expressway.  Make the next left and head north on the service road.  At the first light, make a right onto Middletown Road.  At the end of the street (Stadium Ave), make a left into the park and the first left into the parking lot. Then walk to the meeting spot, as described in option 1, above.
results.name: Pelham Bay woods, City Island, and optional fish dinner

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
Malaysian Food in Chinatown Manhattan

WokWok, 11 Mott Street Basement, NY, NY

Sunday Nov 15@ 12PM

We will share a variety of dishes mostly slightly to medium spicy. If you do not like spices this is not for you. We will share the bill & T+T+$MU Fee.

11/5/2015

I LOVE THIS PLACE! It recently opened up during the beginning of summer, and I've been here a handful of times already. They serve a hybrid of Singaporean, Malaysian, Thai and Chinese food. 

Looking at the bright orange chopsticks, you can tell this restaurant is different from all the others on the street. They give off a very 'hip' or 'modern' vibe in the heart of Chinatown, which not many restaurants strive to do. 

The restaurant is located in the basement, but is hard to miss due to the big sign and their flashy logo. I'd recommend the Chao gwai deu (totally butchered that spelling) with squid, and drunken mein noodles. 

If you like spicy, you've also come to the right place. Their menu has a ton of dishes with little fire icons to convey the level of spiciness. Tip- be sure to ask for the "malaysian hot sauce" which is different from the usual hot sauces.

Limit 8 people. Please be responsible. If you do not show, even once you will be removed from the group. No guests. Only Members.

Sarina
results.name: Malaysian Food CTown NYC Sun Nov 15@ 12:00PM

results.description:
Seething, dark and yet terribly energetic and often funny, say the descriptions.

 "A gang war is raging through the dark underworld of Brighton. Pinkie, malign and ruthless, has killed a man. Believing he can escape retribution, he is unprepared for the courageous Ida Arnold, who is determined to avenge a death." -goodreads

Reviews:

“Here the probing is carried further in a brilliant and uncompromising indictment of some of the worst aspects of modern civilization, showing us the hard-boiled criminal mind not as a return to savagery but as a horrible perversion of cerebration.” —The New York Times

 “Why does this bleak, seething and anarchic novel still resonate? Its energy and power is that of the rebellious adolescent, foreshadowing the rise of the cult of youth in the latter part of the 20th century.” —The Guardian

 “[Greene] believed his coldness vital for his art - 'There is,' he affirmed, 'a splinter of ice in the heart of a writer'.” —John Carey

____________________________ 

** NOTE : I WILL BE EMAILING MEMBERS ASKING YOU TO CONFIRM YOUR "YES" RSVP A FEW DAYS BEFORE THE MEETUP, WITH YOUR REPLY DUE NO LATER THAN APPROXIMATELY 24 HOURS BEFORE THE EVENT SO WE CAN GET A PRETTY ACCURATE HEADCOUNT. PLEASE REMEMBER TO CHANGE A "YES" RSVP TO A "NO" IF YOUR PLANS CHANGE, SO MEMBERS ON THE WAITING LIST HAVE A CHANCE TO READ THE BOOK. AND REMEMBER TO SEE THE "PAGES" LINK FOR THE NO-SHOW POLICY, IT'S STRICTLY ENFORCED. THANKS

results.description:
In my travels at meetup events I have come across many who have expressed an interest in receiving Reiki healing for various reasons, most notably for you who are recently divorced or single for awhile but find that past pain is causing problems in current new relationships or blocking them all together. Trust me you are NOT alone in this need for heart healing. If you do not mend the broken pieces you are only going to hurt others whom you try to get close to.

Traditional rates for individual Reiki sessions are $90 and up per hour and thus cost prohibitive to most of you.  As a Reiki Master and Lightworker it is my goal to work with and help as many people as I possibly can. So with that in mind I am going to offer to you a heart healing workshop in my home and the cost is going to be just $25pp. Please bring cash, exact change. If you can not pay please discuss perhaps we can barter something.

The session will be aprox 2 hrs long, first we will do an exercise to identify some of the hurts and release them. Secondly I will do a guided meditation and give Reiki to each of you while you are meditating. Lastly I will give you each a SpiritStone that I will charge for you personally with some extra Reiki Energy to carry home with you and keep close to your heart.

I do hope that you can join me in this workshop, space is limited but I will offer it again if there is a need. Please dress comfortably, bring water, and maybe bring a blanket or jacket to cover yourself while in meditation. 

Hope to see you there!  With Love and in the Light, Cassie

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!
results.how_to_find_us: please come to back of house, we will be in the basement
results.name: Heal Your Heart Workshop

results.description:
Are you interested in your code having a larger impact than your personal projects or your job? Have you been interested in participating in open source, but never knew how to start? This workshop is going to be focused on getting everyone who attends to make their first contributions to open source Ruby projects. All levels of Ruby experience are welcome!

Prerequisites

Bring a laptop and charger (if you don't have one, you can pair with someone)

Install Ruby 1.9+ (This comes pre-installed on Mac 10.10+. You might also check out RVM)

Create a GitHub account (if you don't already have one)

Download GitHub Desktop, and go through the Tutorial under the Help menu (unless you are already comfortable with Git)

Mentors

If you are experienced in Ruby and open source contribution and would be interested in mentoring, please get in touch: [masked]. We doing all of the planning in a Google Doc, so if you have suggestions of good projects (or better yet, specific issues), please add them there!

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1euyenHR2iYCTXDUBdO8ZBejYQHlJdCuD_LMX-HUmzE8/edit

Our sponsor

Space, snacks, and drinks are being graciously provided by thoughtbot.


We are anticipating high demand for this event, so are charging a nominal fee to ensure those who RSVP actually intend to be there. All proceeds will go towards Meetup group fees.

Let us know in the comments if you have any questions. If you can't make it, don't worry, we plan to do more in the future. Looking forward to seeing you Sunday!
results.name: First-Time Open Source Contributor Workshop [Ruby-Focused­­]

results.description:
Join a bunch of singles from multiple meetup groups in the 50+ age range as we casually stroll through Central Park ending at the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The distance will probably be around 1.5 miles and at a very leisurely pace. Please note that you must conduct the walk. Meeting the group at the museum is not an option. 

Check out some photos from our previous 50+ age range strolls here, here, and here. 

Please arrive at 1 PM. The walk will commence at exactly 1:30 PM. If you are late you will miss us. 

RAIN DATE: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

results.description:
<a href="http://www.moviefone.com/movie/trumbo/20071612/trailers"></a>1:00 

Lunch@Apna Masala Indian Cuisine, 344 E 6th St, New York, NY 10003b/t 1st Ave & 2nd Ave , East Village

TRUMBO

AMC Loews Village 766 3rd Ave. (11th St.), New York, NY 10003 

R| 2 hr. 4 min.

Plot Summary 


The successful career of 1940s screenwriter Dalton Trumbo (Bryan Cranston) comes to a crushing end when he and other Hollywood figures are blacklisted for their political beliefs. TRUMBO (directed by Jay Roach) tells the story of his fight against the U.S. government and studio bosses in a war over words and freedom, which entangled everyone in Hollywood from Hedda Hopper (Helen Mirren) and John Wayne to Kirk Douglas and Otto Preminger.

Cast: Bryan Cranston , Helen Mirren , Diane Lane , Elle Fanning , Louis C.K. , John Goodman , Stephen Root ,Michael Stuhlbarg

Director: Jay Roach

REVIEWS:

TheWrapAlonso DuraldeNov 5,[masked]Roach and McNamara fall victim to the occasional phony biopic moment or straight-up moment of didacticism, but overall Trumbo is a lively history about the day-in-day-out drudgery of survival during oppressive times. Screenwriters are so rarely taken seriously by the film industry that it’s a nice switch to watch them be the heroes.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewLos Angeles TimesRebecca KeeganNov 5,[masked]Trumbo is timely in its portrayal of a moment when political speech is dangerously charged, yet unabashedly old-fashioned in the sincerity of its storytelling.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewSalon.comAndrew O'HehirNov 5,[masked]A clean and agreeable biopic that restores some vitality to a fascinating episode in 20th-century cultural and political history.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewThe New YorkerAnthony LaneNov 2,[masked]The drama is stuck with that ethical rigor, and we are left with a near-heretical irony: thanks to this admiring tribute, our hero gets top billing at last, but was he not more beguiling, somehow, as a legendary figure in the shadows?All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewThe Hollywood ReporterJordan MintzerSep 16,[masked]What makes the movie work are the lively performances, both from the supporting cast and from Cranston, who sheds the mimicry and pontificating of earlier scenes to turn Trumbo into a wry, self-deprecating and somewhat cheeky older man, even if he continued to stand up for what was right.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewThe A.V. ClubTasha RobinsonNov 4,[masked]Trumbo’s writing was so terrific, the film emphasizes, that it outweighed his caustic personality, his unfashionable politics, and the career-threatening dangers of working with him.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewRolling StonePeter TraversNov 4,[masked]Luckily, Trumbo has a powerhouse Bryan Cranston to light a fire under the moldier clichés in John McNamara's script.

results.description:
This workshop examines the common myths and truths about pregnancy nutrition.

When it comes to pregnancy nutrition, understanding which key nutrients are most important can help you make good choices for you and your developing baby. Here are some examples of the myths we will cover that moms-to-be often hear about nutrition and the truth behind the real advice:

• MYTH: Your baby will rely on the nutrient reserves in your body and get everything he needs, regardless of what you eat.

• MYTH: If you didn’t eat balanced meals before becoming pregnant, it’s too late.

• MYTH: Fish is not safe to eat during your pregnancy.

• MYTH: Any food in moderation is fine during pregnancy.


Come for a bit of brunch, interactive learning and mom-to-mom bonding and support =)

Please RSVP and contact Eva for any further questions.
results.how_to_find_us: Text Eva at 914-380-2003 to get the exact location
results.name: Pregnancy/Postpartum Nutrition Myths Debunked: What does "Healthy" really mean?

results.description:
A healthy self-love is the basis of a thriving and fulfilling existence. It informs the energy that we put out into the Universe and it also influences the rest of our relationships. 

Until we treat ourselves as the Divine essences that we are, we will not experience the highest potential of love and inner fulfillment. 

Self-love is a journey...and it starts with a  magical decision to honor the inner Queen first and always...as we re-learn to love ourselves on a higher level, we will experience the miracles that always reflect our inner state of mind. 

Let's reclaim our Divine inner glory so that we may inspire Life to show up with its miracles already awaiting our welcome. 

In this sacred space, we will come together as supportive sisters to heal the stories of our wounded heart, the holes in our soul that have yet to be made whole, and what blocks us from loving ourselves fully. 

In this healing circle, you can expect the following: 


- Meditation. - Inspirational reading. - An open space of serenity, love, and unconditional acceptance. - Tools to practice self-love NO MATTER what life throws at you. - Essential oils tips to anoint your heart. - Open discussion. 


*Suggested donation only ($10)
results.name: Self-Love: Healing Our Relationship With Ourselves

results.description:
Harlem has many scenic areas to take some great photos, and Striver's Row is one of them! Bring your camera (whether it's your phone, point & shoot, or DSLR), have on comfortable walking shoes, and a good spirit as we do a photo walk of Striver's Row, followed by brunch and conversation at The Grange Bar & Eatery. The host for this photo tour will be HarlemGo member Kay Hickman. 

Our Meetup

We'll meetup in front of the Schomburg Center main entrance on Lenox Avenue (Malcolm X Blvd.) between 135th & 136th streets at 1pm and proceed to walk the map route below around 1:15pm, taking photos and getting to know each other along the way. 

The Schomburg Center is point A on the map, the photo tour ends at the Hamilton Grange landmark at point B, then we'll head to The Grange Bar & Eatery after. Feel free to meet the group along the tour, or just for brunch (make sure to RSVP & note in the comments section that you're doing brunch only).

As always, if you're running late, need further directions, or have any questions, please give Daniel a call/text to 774.275.3646.

Directions to The Schomburg Center: 

Train: Take the #2 or #3 trains to 135th Street. The Schomburg entrance is between 135th & 136 streets, on Malcom X Blvd. (Lenox Avenue). 
Bus: Catch either the M7 or M102 to 135th Street and Malcolm X Blvd.

results.description:
12 – 1 pm Healing Clinic, suggested donation $20
Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and the healer will stand nearby, no touching involved), we will join with you silently, embracing your perfect spirit with unconditional love, and ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues. After about 10 minutes, we will share with you the guidance that we receive.

1:30 – 4:30 pm Miracles in Manhattan lecture by Jon Mundy Ph.D.
LECTURE 28: The Goal of Specialness
Based on Chapter 24 from A Course in Miracles Textbook

One Chapter Per Month From the Text of A Course in Miracles
There are 31 Chapters is the Course, so it will take about 3 years to complete this project.


~ $20 per person with advanced registration ~
~ $25 per person at the door without a registration ~
Call[masked] or email [masked] to register in advance.
Your name will be on a list at the door. To pay by credit, card please register in advance.
Or, you can pay with cash or a check at the door.

As long as space is available, “No one is ever turned away.”
Contribute what you can.

You will receive a monthly email reminder with the latest information on the date, time and topic. The schedule can always be found on our website:
www.miraclesmagazine.org

Dr. Jon Mundy met Dr. Helen Schucman, the scribe for A Course in Miracles, in 1973. Helen introduced Jon to the Course and served as his mentor and guide till she became ill in 1980. He is the author of Living A Course in Miracles. After Return to Love by Marianne Williamson, it is currently the best-selling book based on the teaching of A Course in Miracles.

results.description:
For all you Historical Fiction fans, this book is for you! When beautiful, reckless Southern belle Zelda Sayre meets F. Scott Fitzgerald at a country club dance in 1918, she is seventeen years old and he is a young army lieutenant stationed in Alabama. Before long, the “ungettable” Zelda has fallen for him despite his unsuitability: Scott isn’t wealthy or prominent or even a Southerner, and keeps insisting, absurdly, that his writing will bring him both fortune and fame. Her father is deeply unimpressed. But after Scott sells his first novel, This Side of Paradise, to Scribner’s, Zelda optimistically boards a train north, to marry him in the vestry of St. Patrick’s Cathedral and take the rest as it comes.

What comes, here at the dawn of the Jazz Age, is unimagined attention and success and celebrity that will make Scott and Zelda legends in their own time. Everyone wants to meet the dashing young author of the scandalous novel—and his witty, perhaps even more scandalous wife. Zelda bobs her hair, adopts daring new fashions, and revels in this wild new world. Each place they go becomes a playground: New York City, Long Island, Hollywood, Paris, and the French Riviera—where they join the endless party of the glamorous, sometimes doomed Lost Generation that includes Ernest Hemingway, Sara and Gerald Murphy, and Gertrude Stein.

Everything seems new and possible. Troubles, at first, seem to fade like morning mist. But not even Jay Gatsby’s parties go on forever. Who is Zelda, other than the wife of a famous—sometimes infamous—husband? How can she forge her own identity while fighting her demons and Scott’s, too? With brilliant insight and imagination, Therese Anne Fowler brings us Zelda’s irresistible story as she herself might have told it.
results.name: "Z: A Novel of Zelda Fitzgerald," by Therese Anne Fowler

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

The evening's focus will be on "older," "more popular" games (such as Catan, Carcassonne, Dominion, Puerto Rico, Ticket to Ride, Power Grid, etc.) so that newer players can get a solid introduction to these new styles of board games. If your image of "board game" is Sorry, Life, Backgammon, Monopoly, Risk, etc. there's a whole new, better genre waiting for you! (Veteran games and gamers still welcome, of course.)

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.

results.description:
Revolution Books, formerly in Chelsea, will re-open this Sunday, Nov. 15, in Harlem with a special appearance by renowned Kenyan writer Ngũgĩ wa Thiong’o. "Revolution Books is one of a kind—a bookstore about the world … and for a radically different world. It is the one place where people come from all over the world to find the books and the deep engagement about why the world is the way it is and the possibility of a radically different way the world could be." Grand Opening Events on Sunday, November 15
2:00- 4:00 PM:

Reading and Talk by Ngũgĩ wa Thiong’o: “THE BOOK, STORY AND THE CONQUEST OF TIME AND SPACE”
Ngugi is a novelist, playwright, post-colonial theorist, former prisoner of conscience who currently lives in exile. He is a distinguished professor at University of California, Irvine.

Opening remarks from Andy Zee on "Revolution Books and the Emancipation of Humanity." Andy is spokesperson for Revolution Books.

Tickets $30 general, $10 students/Under/unemployed

That this has been but seldom realized is obviously at the root of the futile attempts to do ceremonial and perform ritual, of which the general public hears every now and again."

Please join us for a time of centering, focus and empowerment as we work the Middle Pillar together!

results.description:
Disclosure Network New York

Date: Sunday, Nov. 15, 2015

Location: CAP 21 Studios, 18 West 18th St., (Between 5th Ave. & 6th Ave., South Side of Street), 5th Floor, Room 505, NYC

Time: 2pm-4pm Please arrive 10 minutes in the lobby before 2pm meeting begins in the assigned room! Ask the Welcome Desk person for “Nick Curto's room assignment” if you need help in finding the room. Try to be on time as late arrivals may disrupt the meeting.

Topic(s): “Close Encounter on August 10, 2015 in NYC"

Featured Guest Speaker: MarcBrinkerhoff

Program (Live Event):In a powerful visual and audio presentation, Marc will review his latest encounter which occurred on Monday, August 10th in Central Park and the ramifications of this experience for all of us. He will also show the powerful imagery which is emerging from his recent UFO photography which he has been informed contains transformational energetic frequencies embedded by the benevolent ETs he is intimately in contact with. Part of their message is about the frequency we choose to embrace in this reality. Our choices will either lift us up to transformational experience or keep us locked in the matrix of despair. The choice is ours. When we choose correctly, we can send out our own positive Light Force to transform the world.

He will also reveal how to work with some of the ‘ET Alchemical Universal Symbols’ from the book of the same name he is writing. Many have reported miraculous results from working with these symbols.

Marc is a rare Contactee and Conscious Channel for finer Dimensional ET Universals (Ascended Master ETs), who is able to often call in their inter-dimensional Extraterrestrial Craft to be photographed.

Marc is prominently featured in Timothy Green Beckley’s latest book on world class UFO photographers titled, ‘The UFO Repeaters - Seeing Is Believing - The Camera Doesn’t Lie’. He is also a featured Contactee in the award winning film, by James Carman, “The Hidden Hand”. Marc’s presence in the film provides the benevolent aspect of human ET interaction.

He is here as a cogent reminder that ‘We Are Not Alone’ and never have been. His ongoing ‘contact’ with Benevolent ETs (Universals) was documented in the late 70’s when his amazing prolific UFO Photography attracted multiple UFO organizations. His ET Contact and UFO Photography continues to this day.

Be sure to check his website for the most recent extraordinary photos on October 12, 2015: www.IntergalacticMission.com. Also, Marc requests that you check out the ‘ET Alchemical Universal Symbols’ he has already posted on his site under the link ‘Universal ET Symbols’ before this meeting.

Marc’s Websites:

UFO Site: www.IntergalacticMission.com Art: www.MarcBrinkerhoff.com

Follow Marc:

YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/MarcBrinkerhoff

https://www.facebook.com/marc.brinkerhoff

Please plan to attend what is bound to be one of the most interesting DNNY meetings to date and invite your interested friends to join us! Food or beverages with the only exception of bottled water are not allowed in this venue.

For questions/comments or Press please contact: Nick Curto, DNNY Director/Co-Founder: E-mail: [masked] Phone/Text:[masked]

Meeting Details: Admission $10 per person. Children 12 and under admitted free. Our treasurer will collect your admission fee in the meeting room before the program begins.


R.S.V.P. Strongly recommended for people attending the meeting for the first time. Provide full name, e-mail address and cell phone number per person.

3 Important Notes:

1. No food or beverages are allowed in any rooms of the venue except bottled water that may be brought into the venue. You can also purchase chilled bottled water at the Welcome Desk in the Lobby for $1.
2. Please silence your cell phones when entering the meeting room.
3. No photos may be taken or sound recording is ever allowed at any of the DNNY meetings.

Please visit: www.dnny.info

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 2pm-4:30pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
OPEN HOUSE DATES/TIMES: 
• Sun. Nov. 15th from 2 pm - 5 pm

SITE CONTACT: 
• Janus Welton 

VIRIDIAN FUTURE ONE

Project Owners Abel B’Hahn and Lorna Davis will be starting Phase 2 construction on this gut rehab/addition of their Manhattan luxury townhouse shortly so this is a chance to see a raw property and the challenges it poses to becoming a “Passive House.” The Project Team is striving for Passive House EnerPHit certification, LEED Platinum certification, and healthy “Red List” compliant materials. We will share our project overview and plans for achieving these goals.

PROJECT TEAM:

• Passive House Consultants: Oleg Slivinsky CPHC, Home Green and Janus Welton, CSBA, LEED AP BD+C, EcoArchitecture DesignWorks, PC
• Architect: Irena Skoda, CSBA, LEED AP BD+C, Skoda Design + Architecture 
• Structural / Mech. Engineer: Ed Paknia, MSME, PE, Paknia Engineering 
• LEED/LBC Consultant: Janus Welton, CSBA, LEED AP BD+C, EcoArchitecture DesignWorks, PC 
• LEED CxA: Mina Agarabi, Agarabi Engineering
• Solar PV and Solar Thermal: Green Power Solutions: Thomas Gately 
• Green Roof Systems: Greensulate: Alex Roth and Urban Strong: Alan Burchell 
• Home Automation: Sights n Sounds: Joe Morali
• ERV System: Zehnder: John Rockwell 
• Passive House Windows/Doors: ZOLA: Andrew Grisafi and Ray Whelan 
• Air Sealing: Proclima products: 475  High Performance Building Supply: Floris Keverling Buisman

PROJECT DETAILS: 


Wall Assemblies with Improved Thermal Envelope + Minimization of Thermal Bridging:
• Intello air barrier membrane
• Solitex Mento water resistant membrane 
• Proclima tapes
• Sto-Gold liquid air barrier
• Dense-packed cellulose
• Aerogel Thermablok
• Foam glass
• Vacuum insulated panels

Heating/Cooling and Ventilation:
• Mitsubishi heat pumps
• Zehnder ERV air system

Other Green Features:
• Zola Passive House windows and doors
• Greensulate Green roof system
• Rainwater collection system
• Sun Drum Solar PV /Solar Thermal panels

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED per park rules(turf shoes and indoor shoes are good)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: We have a permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

The game is open for up to 24 players - (11v11 w/ 1 sub each team)

**SOCCER FIELD 6 IS NEXT TO BASEBALL FIELDS 11&12 (north of 97th St Traverse)**

(Leader- Silvia)

(Co-Leader- Francisco)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for any game. Games may be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for any game. Games may be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
I just received  approval for 15 group rate tickets for Fun Home.  I was able to get us orchestra seats regularly priced  at $150 for only $119!!! I have only 15 tickets so the first 15 who pay for their seats get to go!


A little about Fun Home.... It's a  musical adaptation of a memoir by lesbian writer Alison Bechdel called Fun Home: A Family Tragicomic. It chronicles her childhood and youth in rural Pennsylvania focusing on her complex relationship with her father. It is the first Broadway musical with a lesbian protagonist. All I have to say is the song Ring of Keys,  which was performed at this years Tony Awards ,just knocked me off my seat. The acting, directing, and the song floored me with it's intensity and insight. I MUST see this show. You can see the performance on the clip below.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pMAuesRJm1E

TO RESERVE YOUR PLACE:

 Everyone will be on the waitlist until I receive your payment for the ticket.  When payment is received, you will  be placed on the YES list. I have secured 15 Orchestra 1 seats (the best) so the first 15 to pay will receive these discounted tickets. I have to pay for the tickets by September 11th so I will only be accepting payments for the tickets until September 10th. After that this meetup will be closed. 

 Tickets:  Tickets are $119.  You can either mail me a check (message me and I'll send you my mailing address) or you can use PAYPAL. You can PAYPAL me as a family or friend to [masked] no later than September 10th!

DINNER

I will be making reservations for dinner after the show at Benoit New York which is very near the theater. Fun Home runs 1 hour 45 minute show with no intermission so I figure we would do dinner around 5:30PM. Their menu looks delish!http://www.benoitny.com/sites/default/files/menus_pdf/BBNY%20-%20lunch%20%26%20dinner%20menu%20%28truffle%29%20102615%20WEB%20Dinner.pdf


<a href="http://www.benoitny.com/sites/default/files/menus_pdf/WEB%20BBNY%20-%20dinner%20menu%20092315.pdf"></a>
results.name: Fun Home - We got Tickets

Sign-up link for the webinar is here: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/webinars?signinsrc=Meetup-NewYork

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email.


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru
results.name: An Introduction to Inner Engineering--FREE Class (Online Webinar)

Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description: Last time, we discussed the fall of the republic and the birth of an empire.  This time, we'll think about what makes an empire collapse.  Join us to talk about the origins of the Russian Revolution and the fall of the Romanov dynasty.  We'll ponder what the Czars did and whether they could have acted differently.  Was the Revolution inevitable? Could Nicholas II have staved things off? Or had the rot set in too deep, long before? Come to talk it through!

results.description:
Two weeks after the NYC Marathon  
                                       we'll do our Annual Mini-Me  
                                             version of 2.6 miles.  

                                               8th Annual Mini-Me

                                                    Run & Drinks!  

                                             So if you didn't run the  
                                      26 miles of the NYC Marathon  
                                     and if you want to get revved up   
                                       for the 2016 NYC Marathon or 
                                  want to simply get motivated to run - 

                                      Then join us and rock out our  
                                  Mini-Me 2.6 mile version and get  
                                     rewarded afterwards with drinks  
                                                at a nearby cool bar.

We'll be joined by members from other cool Meetup Groups just like this one.  Here are just two that are coming: 

The New York City International Social Group 

Free NYC! Free Things To Do In NYC

The members of these groups 
just like the members of this group,
are at all levels of running abilities,  
from beginners to regular runners, 
who work in mostly professional fields.  

Great people to run and to socialize with.


For New Members & First Time Runners:

It's cool if you're not a speedy runner  
or if you're just starting out. 
You won't be the only one.  Plus, after just your   
first run with us, the run and the running tips,   
will make you a better and faster runner.  

Guaranteed.

After we run, and get our
metabolism into high gear,

We'll go to a nearby cool bar
and reward ourselves for our efforts.  

They have good food and drinks
that are inexpensive and tasty.

Where:

We'll meet right by the entrance to the park  
on Central Park West  
at the corner of W. 86th Street.

Subway: The C train stops right there.  
The 1 train stops on 86th & Broadway.

Click Here For Central Park   
Reservoir Loop Map & Detail

Try to arrive around 3:15.  Keep  
in mind that on weekends, the trains  
aren't always on time.  We'll have about  
30 minute to meet & greet, and we'll  
start running at about 3:45.  

If You Arrive Late:  

In case you arrive late,  
after 3:45, just walk right into the  
park at the West 86th Street entrance  
and walk straight ahead onto the path  
surrounding the reservoir.  

I'll be wearing a black DGA  
(Director's Guild of America)  
baseball hat and I have blond hair.  

That's me in the center:   


At all our Meetups, we always get a whole  
bunch of new members who join us  
and add to the mix.  

If you have any questions  
Shoot me a message.

It's going to be fun.  

See you then!

Marcello  
(Organizer)  


                                                 Get Revved Up!

                                              Don't miss the fun

                                                        Join us

STREET PARKING ONLY~ school remind me that our insurance does NOT cover parking lot.

3:15 pm: arrival, changing and stretching, warm up and passing practice. (while basketball is finishing up and net is being setting up)

results.description:
For members working on writing projects at home who are looking for some feedback - this is the meetup for you. Please post one piece you wish to have critiqued to the Files section of the meetup page by midnight of the Thursday immediately preceding this meetup (giving members enough time to read it!).
Requirement to attend this meeting: read through and critique all recent files (http://www.meetup.com/StatenIsland-Writers/files/) posted by members who have RSVPed "Yes" to this meetup and be prepared to DISCUSS your thoughts (remember we are looking for more than "it was good" - constructive criticism is our bread and butter!). Many members find it helpful to bring notes to share with the writer either written on a printed out copy of the work, or on a separate sheet of paper.

Note:
For all of our meetups at public establishments it is essential that we show our gratitude for the venue that has agreed to host our meetings by being patrons as we enjoy their space. While there is no fee to attend this meetup, please come prepared to purchase something (even if it is something as small as a bottle of water) from the cafe.

results.description:
Learn how to ‘tap’ your way to a happier and more fulfilling life using Emotional Freedom Techniques. EFT is a simple yet incredibly effective method of self healing that can be used to immediately reduce anxiety, stress, and other emotions that stand in our way of living in a place of optimum well-being and personal peace. Together we will do lots of EFT tapping to work on individual and collective issues of concern. The more of us who tap together in a group format, the more benefit can be received by all.

At this meetup we will continue exploring the nature of our mind and emotions and learn how to identify ‘stories’ we tell about ourselves that contribute to any sense of personal 'Not-OKness'. Then we can release the charge these stories carry with EFT and increase our personal Emotional Freedom!


One of the special features of our Meetup is that we demonstrate how we have unconscious blocks to happiness and Emotional Freedom. Using Energetic Rescripting Process (ERP), a technique that borrows from Kinesiology and EFT, we locate the nature of these blocks and remove them.


Even from the demos we do in our Meetups people get back to me with remarkable stories of how things in their life are shifting for the better!


Registration for this meeting is requested but not required. There is a nominal $5 charge although a donation of $15-$20 is suggested (donations are shared with The New Dawn Foundation).


All are welcome (adults 17 and up who are emotionally comfortable in group settings).

Those new to EFT are asked to join our meetup group to have access to a variety of useful information and resources about EFT (listed under to MORE/FILES tab of this meetup site). Click here to read a primer about using EFT.

You can also find instructional videos and more posted on our new Emotional Freedom Facebook page:
http://www.facebook.com/EFTforEmotionalFreedom


Being already somewhat familiar with EFT will help to minimize our time explaining why we are tapping and saying these strange things, and maximize our time sharing from our personal experiences and using our techniques to release the emotions that no longer serve our well being.
results.how_to_find_us: Its a bit sneaky to find... continue down Davenport ave past the beach clubs and marinas and just past Imperial Yacht club there's a tiny driveway entrance with a sign and mailbox that says New Dawn Foundation... Its the White House by the water.

results.description:
Nettles Artists Collective and East 3rd Productions continue their commitment to producing engaging free staged readings of Tennessee Williams' work with a presentation of Kingdom of Earth directed by Alaina Albertson.  

The Tennessee Williams Project, by East 3rd Productions, aims to engage citizens with the writer's work through free readings which are followed by an engaging and democratic post-reading discussion exploring the relevance of Williams' work in contemporary society. 

DETAILS:

• SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 15TH AT 5PM 

• LOCATION: PUNTO SPACE 325 WEST 38TH STREET, STOREFRONT #3, NEW YORK, NY 10018

• THIS EVENT IS FREE.   SPACE IS LIMITED.    AFTER THE READING THERE WILL BE AN OPEN SALON DISCUSSION ABOUT THE PLAY (suggested donation $5)  

Kingdom of Earth is a serio-comedy first produced in 1968.  The play focuses on Lot, an impotent transvestite obsessed with the memory of his mother. He returns to his ancestral home accompanied by his new bride, Myrtle, a sometime prostitute and former showgirl. She soon discovers Lot only wants to use her to steal the deed to the property from his multiracial half-brother Chicken, who has lived on and farmed the property for years. Once Chicken meets Myrtle, he gets some romantic designs of his own.


This is the second presentation of the project hosted by Nettles Artists Collective's Salon Series in their artistic home in midtown Manhattan, Punto Space.  This past September, Nettles Artists Collective's Salon Series presented The Rose Tattoo. The Nettles' Salon Series exist in the spirit of 17th century French salon gatherings which aim to inspire, provoke and, most of all, engage through conversation.  The collaboration between the two companies seem like a natural one, unifying their common purpose between the Salon Series and The Tennessee Williams Project. 

To see photos from The Rose Tattoo, click HERE

"I have found it easier to identify with the characters who verge upon hysteria, who were frightened of life, who were desperate to reach out to another person. But these seemingly fragile people are the strong people really."  Tennessee Williams. 


Thomas Lanier "Tennessee" Williams III (March 26, 1911 – February 25, 1983) was an American playwright and author of many stage classics. He is considered among the three foremost playwrights in 20th century American drama. Tennesse Williams won two Pulitzer Prizes, for "A Streetcar Named Desire" (1947) and "Cat on a Hot Tin Roof" (1955).


Nettles Artists Collective's mission: to imbue the American art scene with globally diverse voices and multidisciplinary collaborations by providing a platform for the performing and visual arts. 


East 3rd Productions' mission: to facilitate art anytime, anywhere, any way, empowering artists to create multidisciplinary work which communicates across social, cultural, and political lines. East 3rd Productions seeks out innovative, intellectual, and exciting work, nurturing the creative impulses of its permanent members, collaborators, and future theater and film artists.
results.name: Nettles Artists Collective's Salon Series: The Tennessee Williams Project

results.description:
Prior to Obamacare, the US was the only developed country without socialized medicine.

The health care system had the following problems:

• Medical providers negotiated rates with insurance companies.  Since providers would negotiate different rates with different insurers, it was difficult for a provider to answer the question "How much does procedure X cost?", also, they would have to offer a list price higher than any of the negotiated rates, which the uninsured, usually the poorest, would have to pay.

• Since the price of health care was such a complex question, and insured people's out-of-pocket costs were generally unaffected by the price of their health care, it was difficult for consumers to shop around and insured consumers had no incentive to do so.  Most health care consumers would purchase health care without any regard to price, resulting in runaway health cost inflation.  Interestingly, the cost of cosmetic surgery, which is usually uninsured, rose more slowly than overall inflation.


• The leading cause of personal bankruptcy in the USA was medical bills received by uninsured people.

• Health insurance was extremely expensive for people with pre-existing conditions, if it was available at all.  Many states, however, offered programs where the state subsidized health insurance for difficult to insure people, though many such people were not aware of these programs.

• A 1986 law required emergency rooms to treat patients regardless of whether they could pay.  As a result, many of the poor and uninsured would go to emergency rooms, often for conditions that were not emergencies, with no intention of ever paying.  Hospitals, seeing emergency rooms as hemorrhaging loss centers, were closing them down, resulting in a shortage of emergency rooms across the country.

• Health care inflation far outstripped overall inflation, causing medical spending to be an ever-increasing share of GDP, with a smaller and smaller fraction of the public being able to afford health care.

• While most people had access to high quality health care through employer-offered health insurance, those who didn't often found that individual health insurance policies were in a "death spiral", where individual insurance was so expensive that only sick people would buy it, driving premiums up even further.  People who might have preferred to work for themselves or for small companies that didn't offer health insurance stayed trapped in jobs they didn't like, just to get health insurance.  People also entered into "health insurance marriages", marrying people they didn't love, just as an arrangement to give one party access to the other's employer-sponsored health plan.

Was Obamacare an unacceptable response to these problems, and if not, why not, and what should have been done in it's place?

This event is co-listed with 2 other meetups.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the front, and I'll have a sign on the table.
results.name: Obamacare

The health care system had the following problems:

• Medical providers negotiated rates with insurance companies.  Since providers would negotiate different rates with different insurers, it was difficult for a provider to answer the question "How much does procedure X cost?", also, they would have to offer a list price higher than any of the negotiated rates, which the uninsured, usually the poorest, would have to pay.

• Since the price of health care was such a complex question, and insured people's out-of-pocket costs were generally unaffected by the price of their health care, it was difficult for consumers to shop around and insured consumers had no incentive to do so.  Most health care consumers would purchase health care without any regard to price, resulting in runaway health cost inflation.  Interestingly, the cost of cosmetic surgery, which is usually uninsured, rose more slowly than overall inflation.

• The leading cause of personal bankruptcy in the USA was medical bills received by uninsured people.

• Health insurance was extremely expensive for people with pre-existing conditions, if it was available at all.  Many states, however, offered programs where the state subsidized health insurance for difficult to insure people, though many such people were not aware of these programs.

• A 1986 law required emergency rooms to treat patients regardless of whether they could pay.  As a result, many of the poor and uninsured would go to emergency rooms, often for conditions that were not emergencies, with no intention of ever paying.  Hospitals, seeing emergency rooms as hemorrhaging loss centers, were closing them down, resulting in a shortage of emergency rooms across the country.

• Health care inflation far outstripped overall inflation, causing medical spending to be an ever-increasing share of GDP, with a smaller and smaller fraction of the public being able to afford health care.

• While most people had access to high quality health care through employer-offered health insurance, those who didn't often found that individual health insurance policies were in a "death spiral", where individual insurance was so expensive that only sick people would buy it, driving premiums up even further.  People who might have preferred to work for themselves or for small companies that didn't offer health insurance stayed trapped in jobs they didn't like, just to get health insurance.  People also entered into "health insurance marriages", marrying people they didn't love, just as an arrangement to give one party access to the other's employer-sponsored health plan.

Was Obamacare an unacceptable response to these problems, and if not, why not, and what should have been done in it's place?

This event is co-listed with the Fans of Capitalism meetup.

results.name: Was Obamacare a Bad Idea?

results.description:
Getting into our Right Mind: The Practice of Meditation
with Alex Bonano

At the moment, we do not recognize the vast potential of the mind.  We relate to a mind that feels stuck in negativity, and we experience the world as a place of problems and suffering that we can do little to change. But when we experience our mind directly we discover that it has a limitless potential, and is capable of limitless love, wisdom and joy. By going deep into the heart and connecting to the limitless potential of the mind, we will discover we have the power to free ourselves from negativity, and to change our experience of the world.Sept 13:    The Wonders of the Mind


Sept 20:  The Peaceful Nature of the Mind
Sept 27:   Limitless Mind, Limitless Potential
Oct 4:       Getting into the Heart 

Weekly guided meditations and Buddhist teachings in Astoria are suitable for both beginners and more advanced meditation practitioners.  These classes offer meditation techniques and teachings on the fundamentals of Buddhism, with an emphasis on their practical application in everyday life.

Although these meditation classes are given as a series, they can also be taken individually. Please feel free to drop in on a class-by-class basis.

Classes are held every week unless otherwise stated.
No special clothing is required. No pre-registration required.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Usually around 9ish

results.description:
Evidence supporting reincarnation, and do we remember our past lives? If not, why not?

AN ending is just a new beginning in disguise it’s been said. This perfectly describes the ancient belief in the soul’s immortality and continuity through reincarnation. The spiritual eye of light,(represented in the human brain by the pineal gland), is more and more activated as we progress through spiritual evolution’s wisely appointed reincarnations. Such stages are necessary to finally achieve “conscious god-hood,” in the words of Theosophical Pioneer W. Q. Judge, all the while living a human existence on Earth, Judge concluding: “Getting back the memory of other lives is really the whole of the process…” Mr.Judge in his Letter 5 also notes: “if some people don’t understand certain things, it is either because they have not got to that point in their other lives, or because no glimmer of memory has yet come.” Some people do have such glimmers, and as often such recalls have the power to heal, physically and emotionally.
results.name: Reincarnation and Karma, Q & A Discussion

No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.

  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. we had so many people we couldnt accomodate all but its was a great show and i hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Gregory K. (Orange is the new black, Reds Husband), Mark Normand (Conan, Last Comic), Ryan Reiss (Comedy Central), Dante Nero (Showtime), Jared Freid (MTV), Hosted by Jonathan Randall and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members.

This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Ok folks, it's the third Sunday of the month, again- the day you all get to have a great time being being horrible people with a rousing game of Cards Against Humanity. Because so many of you enjoy it, we decided it was best to give you monthly recurring opportunities to be horrible. I'm sure we're doing a great service providing a safe outlet for these urges.

We'll be playing at The Uncommons, a tabletop gaming cafe. If by any chance Cards Against Humanity isn't your thing, they literally have a menu of dozens of games for you to enjoy, along with more typical menus for things like food and drink. For the small fee of $5 plus tax, all of these things will be available to you for the entire evening (The games, not the food and drink).

So come out and enjoy the guilty pleasure of being acceptably horrible with a card game, or play another game and sit in quiet judgment of the rest of us (both options have their appeal). Either way, join us for some fun games and good company this weekend.

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs

results.description:
This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.
